description:
For the price point we like naked fish a lot. Hand rolls are a phenomenal deal at $4.50 ea. Great amount of fish, and a good selection. This place is not going to blow your mind (which seems to majorly be the complaints) but it's a solid choice for middle of the road sushi. 

If you're looking for a quick lunch in the marina, look no further.
author: Adele T.

description: Not only was the staff incredibly polite and accommodating, but the sushi was super fresh and the amount of food for the price you pay makes this place deserve all five stars hands-down. Delicious, nice ambiance and great location. I had the bento box with spicy tuna roll and chicken teriyaki. Chicken was super tender and plenty of tuna in the roll. Miso was just right with smaller cubes of tofu and salad dressing very tasty! Had 2 pieces of salmon nigiri which were larger in size then the norm. Overall terrific and highly recommended.
author: Andy D.

description: Food was decent. Service was the WORST I have ever had. I was with four friends, we ordered all at the same time, miso and edamame to start. Miso came out straight away, edamame never came. I ordered two rolls, everyone else ordered one roll each. 20 minutes later my rolls (and only mine) came out. 15 minutes later, one other roll came out for friend #1. He asked for a beer at that time as well, which never came. Then two rolls came out on the same plate for friend #2 and #3. They were separate orders and not sitting near each other. Friend #4's food didn't come out for 45 minutes. At that point, we told them that it hadn't come and to not worry about it, we figured it's a wash and ask for the bill. Then friend #4's roll comes out 5 minutes later, but no bill. At this time we just wanted to pay and leave. Then the waitress apologized and offered to give us a $3 edamame on the House after we had all finished eating our rolls. Great timing. We said no, paid, and left. It's a pity because the food was alright...
author: Pete S.

description:
Following up to my previous review. After eating at this restaurant I experienced stomach issues.Quick look on the SF health inspection site indicates this restaurant has had issues with "Foods not protected from contamination" and "Inadequate and inaccessible hand washing facilities." 

I also made an attempt at contacting the restaurant with no response. Visit this place with caution. Or maybe not at all.
author: Ralph A.

description: really good service. the food was not too expensive and tasted amazing and very fresh. definitely would come again
author: Carsyn H.

description: Lunch for two was $23. In San Francisco, that's damn good unless you're at Subway. And the food was pretty good. We had tempura, katsu chicken and spicy tuna rolls, and the salad accompanying our bento box meals was fresh and well-complimented by a ginger dressing. Two thumbs up for steaming mugs of genmaicha tea.
author: Steve L.

description:
Bottom line: Good value during happy hour.

Context: I have visited many times for happy hour.  Once or twice for dinner.

Happy Hour exists every day of the week (though I believe the hours are different from Fri-Sun).  The specials are great - many $5 appetizers, $3 hand rolls, $4 sushi rolls.  Deals on sake and beer too.

The sushi is fine.

Service is always friendly.  Attentiveness can vary depending on how many servers are working and who you get, but overall is fine.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Surprisingly good sushi happy hour at the right price. The sushi is pretty good for the price, not fabulous. Good location in the marina so easy to get to.
author: Jenn A.

description: Great neighborhood lunch spot! I love the 49er roll. It's so refreshing and unique, with a great combo of flavors!
author: Ashley M.

description:
I know the fish is not fresh because my salmon was literally frozen.  I actually heard sounds of bitting into ice.  I'm not exaggerating.  That actually happened.  

Also the service is horrible.  The whole time I was there, all I hear is these waitresses complaining about their customers in Cantonese.  

If I can give zero stars I would.
author: Janet S.

description: Really expected more from Naked Fish. Perhaps I'm spoiled when it comes to sushi living in Seattle, but I found the rolls here tasteless.  The fish had very little texture or flavor and the rice had no flavor whatsoever.  I was hoping that San Francisco would be a great spot for sushi, and maybe I picked the wrong spot, but I can say without compunction that I won't be returning to Naked Fish for quite some time, if ever.
author: Jeff H.

description:
As a frequent habitué of Chestnut St, I can't believe I waited so long to give this place a try. Great sushi and service! (My bride's chicken teriyaki was mediocre -- but you didn't intend to order that anyway, right?)

And yea, I used the term habitué. Wanna fight about it?! Loser buys the sushi. ;)
author: Todd D.

description: Soft shell crab is not good at all! The crab is soooo thin and mostly batter, my fingers where huge next to the crab legs and I have thin fingers. I did not taste crab at all.  Just not worth the small, tiny and mostly batter crab. But the dinner box with salmon, tempura and teriyaki chicken was good.
author: Bernadette F.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. I come here at least once a month for the happy hour pricing and stay way too long because of the friendly and accommodating staff, incredibly fresh and delicious fish, and the great ambiance. I know the staff well at this point and love seeing them because they always provide great service and don't judge me for the questionable amount of spicy mayo I always ask for with my sushi. If you're looking to ball out on a budget or impress your date while not wrecking your bank account, this is the place to be!!
author: Austin S.

description:
Not the best of service.  Was interrupted a few times from the servers and had our table cleared when we were still eating.  

The tuna roll lacked seasoning and the rice in the roll was rather dry.

Also, had my credit card double charged after our table of three split three ways.
author: Kelton M.

description:
Naked Fish is a decent sushi restaurant with a bar in the front, and opens into a larger dining area towards the back. The menu items are hit or miss, but the happy hour specials are great.

Poke Tuna - marinated tuna w/ spicy Hawaiian poke sauce:
Good! tasty & spicy cubes of dressed tuna, adorned with seaweed salad and cucumber slices, & topped with sesame seeds

Ahi Tartare - tuna, avocado, tofu with wonton strips:
Meh! The tuna was okay, but the flavors of tofu and tuna didn't go very well together, in my opinion.

Chicken Yakitori:
Good! simple cubes of dark chicken meat, topped with teriyaki sauce

Calamari:
Okay! pretty good octopus with not too heavy batter, served w/ sweet chili sauce

Maguro Nigiri:
Meh, not the most fresh, or vibrant in color

I've tried some of the rolls. To me, sushi rolls tend to taste the same, since a lot of them have the same ingredients - avocado, tempura, sesame seeds, scallions, etc.

Autumn Delight Roll - Tuna, albacore, avocado, lightly tempura seared and served with lemon ponzu:
Pretty Good! The fried tempura cooks up the tuna inside quite a bit. I wouldn't mind if the tuna were a little more rare.

Firecracker Ball - deep-fried tuna roll w/ house special sauce, scallions, sesame seeds:
Okay! & quite spicy

Hot Mama Special Roll - Snow crab roll wrapped with salmon, baked with sweet and spicy dressing:
Not bad, but the rice tasted especially cold, like the roll had been sitting in the fridge for a while.

If I were in the area, I would stop by during happy hour for some tuna poke and nigiri.
author: Joy W.

description:
Missed the happy hour so we decided to get some rolls instead. The chutoro (fatty tuna) has a fantastic flavor and super tender texture, and I loved the dynamite roll. 

Rolls came out literally in minutes, this place is well staffed, and servers are friendly. 

Food: 4.5/5
Value: 3.5/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4.25/5
author: Brian G.

description: We work around the corner and sister in law tried this place for the first time . Place is small but very efficient and if you order online is faster. Highly recommend this place.
author: Liliana P.

description: My friend told me about their Happy Hour specials on sushi, so I finally came here for Happy Hour. I got 5 different rolls and 2 hand rolls to split with my friend. I liked the shrimp tempura roll, Hot Mama, salmon avocado roll, and hand roll. My friend and I paid $19 each.
author: Denise C.

description:
Highly recommend the salmon sashimi; melts in your mouth like butter!

Really enjoyed the variety of rolls....really have no complaints!

Don't let the somewhat "empty" interior fool you: most of the people didn't sit up front at the sushi bar but were in the back room. 

We will come back!
author: Kelly K.

description: This was a pleasant find. From the outside it looks like they only have a small eating area in front but they actually have a large section in the back. I really enjoyed the ambiance. The happy hour is literally one of the best in the city for sushi as far as price. We ordered one of almost everything. I will be back to take advantage of the happy hour. Quality of the food was standard. A couple of the rolls were "misses" but no major complaints.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Here are reasons of me giving them 1.

1. Warm plates for raw fish items. Even for sashimi. 
2. Luke warm miso soup. Had to send it back. And it came out still luke warm. 
3.Extremely salty rolls. The fish taste like pasty salt. 
4. Oily grilled items 

The only thing ok was nigiry. 
Service was good in fairness. 

Hope they they improve and keep up their business.
author: Yeb L.

description: The service and sushi was okay, but the bento box had low quality meat that tastes pretty gross.
author: Erica W.

description: Great service. For a good price you will be filled with a variety of food. The environment is welcoming and harmonious. Also, family friendly with seating in front and back of restaurant.
author: Donovan S.

description:
Pretty good. 3.5 is a little rough. Do people not know fresh fish?

Sushi was better than roles.  Come and try it out at happy hour.  Generous sake bottles as well.
author: Anand A.

description: The sushi is sub par and there aren't many options, we usually feel rushed by staff to order and then rushed to leave, there are definitely better options for sushi in SF
author: Hallie M.

description: The quality of the fish was good, but this was probably the worst service I've had in a restaurant for a few years. The food came out wrong multiple times (completely wrong orders). Some things didn't come out and when we asked they said they were making a new batch and wouldn't come or for quite some time--this would have been good to tell us instead of us having to ask. No apologies, just acted like we were rude for inquiring... keep in mind everything else had been served. Very inattentive about water or taking our order. The restaurants on this street are always packed and have a wait; there is a reason this one does not.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I have been going to naked fish since it opened years ago.  They were always consistently good, fresh and clean.  However, this most recent experience was awful and i am not sure if it has just gone down hill and run its course or it was an off night.

First of all, we found a fly in our bottle of soy sauce.  This is a bottle THEY fill, not an original bottle.  The place looked filthy and we were very put off.  

The sushi was fair- the california rolls do not have real crab, the spicy scallop roll was terrible (i was worried about getting sick so i did not eat it).  The only good thing about the entire experience was the chicken teriyaki my kids ordered and the waitress (she was really lovely).

I would recommend finding another place.  This place is like stomach roulette....  you are either going to get sick from the filth or the lack of freshness.
author: Samantha B.

description: It is great sushi, but it takes very long for it to be served. They are fairly low on staff. I would not recommend if you are in a rush and just want a quick bite.
author: Mariela V.

description: Nice place and reasonably priced. I had the miso soup, California roll, tuna roll, and salmon migiri. Only came out to $21.
author: Jonathon S.

description: OK first thing is first, happy hour! This is the place to go to find amazing sushi at amazing prices in SF. Within this happy hour time not only can you try  a good selection of sushi but you can also leave a full and happy. The best thing about these guys is that during happy hour it's not busy if you come in early.  Like on the dot! Otherwise, 30-45 min later they will be slammed. Hurray for happy hour sushi!
author: Hector C.

description: Amazing dinner tonight.  We made it for happy hour and it was HAPPY !!! I so recommend this restaurant. The staff was awesome. The fish was so fresh and color beautiful. If you are in town or live here you need to visit. It was clean and cute place. I will be back definitely!!!!  A+++ rating in my book
author: Wendy G.

description: Bring back the Snow White roll. It really did the job and was delish-O. My wife still talks about the delicious snow crab and ranch combo pack. It was amazing!
author: Sean K.

description:
Came here for happy hour. Great specials. Everything was so cheap and the portions were on point. I loved the agedashi tofu. 

The service could be a little more on point. 

The restaurant is funky looking. The bar is in the front and the dining room is in he back. Good place though. I would recommend it
author: Tony C.

description:
This place certainly gets tight quickly when there's a crowd and be prepared to wave down your server when you need something, because according to our service and the service of the people next to us, they rarely stop by to check on their own accord. 

The food however was a pleasant surprise. The poke bowl is a delight as a starter. It's super fresh with a clean flavor and the miso soup, though admittedly a tough dish to mess up, was probably the best I had. Also, if you order an entree (I had the teriyaki salmon! Yum!) they give you a pretty good sized portion. So that made me happy. The sushi rolls were what you would expect from any Japanese restaurant.

So, I give it 4 instead of 5 stars just because I'm about 98% sure the server forgot to bring me a spoon for my soup, and I ended up slurping the whole thing from the bowl because it began to get cold before anyone came by to check on us again (which actually wasn't until our entrees came).
author: Destini M.

description:
I went here for happy hour with my roommate before we went off to our respective events (for me it was a Yelp Elite event, and for her a work-related event at a bar nearby).  The happy hour menu is an extensive one compared to other menus I've seen at sushi restaurants.  And the prices were really good too.

I ordered the crunchy cannon roll, which was $6 (normally $8).  It was really delicious!  It was fried to perfection, and the honey mustard and unagi glaze gave it sweetness.  I can predict that some people might find this signature roll too sweet, but I enjoyed it.  What I also like was that they didn't skimp on the portion.  I got about 10 pieces, which didn't make me full, especially since I also ordered ahi poke.  Which, btw, was also very good.  It came with wontons, and added a salty flavor to this acidic dish.

The atmosphere is dark, and it can get loud inside.  The wait staff are really friendly and are happy to answer any questions you have.

I would definitely come back here and take advantage of their happy hour menu.  You get the best of what they offer at a good price, especially for the Marina.
author: Vira P.

description:
https://restaurantresurrection.com/2016/09/19/naked-fish/

A couple weeks ago, I stumbled upon this little gem, and boy was I...

pleasantly surprised!

My husband and I were actually trying to go eat at Pacific Catch, but our daughter's stroller wouldn't even make it through their front door (we'll have to go back by ourselves).

This place looks much smaller on the outside than it is on the inside. There are a few tables up front, and then a small walkway pours into a fairly large (for a sushi place) dining room in the back.

Walking through the front door we were immediately greeted, and shown to a table in the back. There were only 2 other tables seated in the dining room, however; it was about 1:45PM. Once seated, a friendly server got our drink order right away. She proceeded to meet all the steps of service in timely manner. Now, on to the food...

It was great! We got 2 bento plates which included 2 types of sushi of our choice, salad, rice and a miso soup for under $9.00. I expected these bento's to be pretty small because of the price, but they were fairly large portions. We really enjoyed every part of our time here, and I can't wait to come back for more!

Side note:  This restaurant closes between the hours of 2:30PM-4:30PM.  We didn't know that and I felt bad for coming in so close to closing, but they didn't seem bothered at all (which is very hard to find).

My Recommendations:

I don't have any recommendations for this restaurant as far as what they can do to improve themselves, because they exceeded all of my expectations. I will instead list the areas in which I believe they are leading by example.

Friendly staff (even when they are trying to close)
Exceptional food; I hate when sushi leaves a fishy taste in my mouth, and their fish was very fresh
Fair price point; Sushi tends to be overly priced because it's difficult for some owners to see the profit margin they want to see charging fair prices for sushi rolls, but that's a quick way to scare away potential customers.
Overall, I was very happy, and I will be returning.
author: Brittany A.

description:
Was in the neighborhood and needed a cheap bite. We made it to their happy hour and the deals are totally worth it! Lots of apps for $5, $1 oysters, and large beers for $4! 

The boyfriend and I got some oysters, two rolls, some nigiri and a beer, which all came out quickly with great service. Everything was fresh and the oysters were super fresh. My only minor complaint was that the rolls are a bit small for $8. They have one small TV in the front of the restaurant with bar seating, so that filled up pretty quickly since it was Game 6 of the NBA finals. More seating in the back, but I don't think they had another TV.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Fabulous food, quick and easy customer service. Love. Love the bento boxes and the spicy tuna rolls.
author: Walter P.

description:
Great location and a nice layout, but that's about it. 

This place has the potential to be a great place, but it's far from that right now.

The food is just ok, I've had much much better. The fish IMO wasn't fresh at all. The sashimi was somewhat soggy. The rolls were over stuffed with imitation crab. The fish tacos, avoid at all cost. We ordered alot of food and I wasn't impressed or happy. 

It was a empty restaurant on a Friday night at 8pm. That should be telling. I didn't pick this place, and I do not recommend anyone to go here. 

As a plus, they rolled the trash cans in and through the restaurant during dinner hours. That was funny and unsanitary at the same time.
author: Carrie Y.

description:
First visit today.  Nice atmosphere... got the romantic table by the kitchen.  Good service and happy hour prices, but the sushi is just OK.  The deep fried specialty rolls have a lot of character but in the end aren't as good as the non-fried ones.  

Watch out on the tip guide on the credit card statement - they have it set to be based on post-tax prices.
author: G M.

description:
I came here with some friends for a Sunday night dinner.  For a Sunday night this place was quite busy.  We got seated in the back room that has an interesting sunroof and a small backyard in the back.  There were 2-3 other large parties and the room was quite loud.  It was a bit hard to hear everyone and I was (jokingly but not really) saying to my friends that I was going to deduct 1 star in my Yelp review for acoustics.  If you come here for a quiet date night, you're going to have a bad time.

I always feel a bit strange reviewing restaurants that focus mostly on sushi since I actually don't eat sushi.  I always get entrees at these places.  This time, I tried their duck in a miso vinagrette sauce.  The duck was actually cooked pretty well and the meat was on top of a bed of lettuce.  My only gripe is that by default there is no rice - dude, I'm super Asian, and if I'm ordering a meat dish, there should be rice with it.

The edamame on the table was actually salted well. I've had my fair share of bland edamame so I'm always glad when I stumble upon salted edamame.  I like salt, so what.

I did try a fried scallop (I think this was the fire cracker ball sushi dish).  The others at the table liked this dish a lot and one of my friend who is a regular claimed this was one of his favorite dishes.  My opinion was oh god this is gross but remember I don't like sushi, so let's just go with my friends' opinions.

The fried green tea ice cream was okay.  The batter tasted like tempura but the dish was mostly cold ice cream.  

I would probably NOT go out of my way to go here since their menu is so focused on sushi but if you have sushi lovers, this might be a good place to take them.
author: Danielle C.

description: I used to like this place for lunch but the food quality has become pretty bad. There was also lots of confusion on the part of the wait staff.
author: Jonathan P.

description: I brought my parents here for their first time in a sushi restaurant. They really liked the salad and vegetable tempura. I couldn't get them to try any sushi but I really liked the spicy tuna roll that came in my bento box. This place is really affordable too!
author: Bailey R.

description: The food here is exceptional - so much yumminess in every dish they output. But second to that, the service here is a breath of fresh air. Everyone is welcoming, attentive, warm and very friendly. It's the kind of place I'd want to give my money to even if the food wasn't great. Luckily for me - the food IS great and the customer service is fabulous. Such a lovely place to dine.
author: Caitlin D.

description: The waitress was really sweet and patient! I only had hundred bills so before ordering I went to a Starbucks to change it and she kept my seat for me!! I order a tuna avocado and a California roll. It was really good!
author: Caroline F.

description: Love the lunch special: choose 2 plus rice, salad & miso soup for $8.95. Can't beat that! Staff is very friendly. Had the appetizer poke once and not sure I'd recommend it- too salty - but everything else I've had is great!
author: Phoebe M.

description: Friendly!!!!!!! Also the music???? On point. I would give them 10 stars and the food was incredibly tasty but what stands out above all is THEIR FRIENDLINESS :)
author: Ársalan K.

description:
Not one star because it's a step above places like Kitaro and Kiki's. I didn't plan to go here, per se, so I didn't expect much. Killing time while waiting at Apple across the street. 

One order of sake nigiri, two orders of hotate nigiri, one spider roll. The nigiri was decent, not great. On the small side. The roll left much to be desired. Possibly the worst spider roll I've ever had. They really skimp on the soft shell crab, and I think the crab is over-cooked. 

Service is shitty. One server complained to me that a couple who sat next to me at the bar left before ordering after the female used the bathroom: "Oh, they left? But she used our bathroom! Humph!" Big deal! And I don't care. Inappropriate. The chef behind the bar asked me for a plate back after I ate an order "to save a plate." I might do this at home, but this is a restaurant. Shall I recline all over your chairs and use a table as a foot stool?
author: Paulina F.

description: Naked Fish is a reliable high quality neighborhood sushi restaurant.  Food is fresh and good!!.  We often order to go or for delivery.  Never had a bad dish.
author: P S.

description: Love this little gem that you might miss while walking along Chestnut, but the happy hour deals cannot be beaten. Come here around dinner time for fast service and quality sushi at a great price. My friends and I ordered four rolls and the total was under $20, this is a really quick place that will definitely satisfy your sushi cravings.
author: Martina L.

description:
Great sushi spot and the wine is reasonably priced--went with a friend and we split a bottle. We also split 4-5 rolls, and food & drink total was under $30 per person.

There are a lot of unique rolls here and I'd say it's a good place to step outside your comfort zone and order something a little different. I'll be back to try the appetizers also, as I've heard they are great but was really just in the mood for sushi during my last visit.
author: Catherine C.

description:
The environment of Naked Fish is very nice.  Immediately upon walking in you get the sense that it has taken the traditional Japanese idea and brought it to the hip and modern San Francisco scene.  That being said, it's still quiet and feels intimate.  The waiters come around to check in at a nice pace too.

The sushi was good, but average.  I liked their unique naming systems and we enjoyed our selections greatly, but I've had similar experiences elsewhere.  The Happy Hour prices are excellent though and make having a little sushi tasting party easy!  This is a good place to go if you're a casual sushi fan and are looking for a quiet little place to dine in.
author: Leslie D.

description:
Number one: Before naked fish, the only sushi I've had has been store brought from Whole Foods.

Number two: the happy hour is from 4:30-6:30pm and totally worth it. Discounted menu=happy in debt grad students that will keep coming back! 

Number three: The fire cracker balls, crunchy cannon & sake mojitos were lip smacking good. 

Number four: Naked Fish is too cool for anything less than 4 stars.
author: Court S.

description:
I read a lot of bad reviews before heading in here so I braced myself for poor service and some possible bad menu options believing that the low priced happy hour specials would prove worth it. 

Naked Fish is so bad. I have no idea how they are still in business. 

Contrary to many other reviews, the service was good. The food was disgusting.  

The chicken kaarage was inedible in every sense of the word. It was gross tough chicken parts deep fried. It say boneless meat and in hindsight, I think they would've said breast/thigh/wing meat at the least. 

The salmon tartare with wonton chips was so oddly greasy and you just fill with regret as you're chewing it. 

In no way whatsoever can I recommend the firecracker balls. I was excited to see them come out - they looked good! The inside was revolting. Chewy flavorless gunk was inside of these fried mystery balls. 

The only 'eh' part of the meal were 2 rolls - spicy salmon and spicy tuna. Both were rolled a bit loose but otherwise tasted moderately accurate. They weren't worth the $4 happy hour price if that tells you anything. 

Overall, I regret not trusting the Yelp world and can only hope I don't sick from the awful excuse for food I just ate (no I didn't finish a single dish for obvious reasons).
author: Nicholas H.

description: We ordered the uni after spirit tasting at Fort Mason. Even after all that alcohol and having our taste buds killed I could taste the metallic flavor of their uni. Horrible, not coming here again.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Cute place.

But, it's not the best sushi ever in all the Bay Area kind of deal. 
My cousins and I thought the portions were small.

***Oysters were super good, that I recommend. Some small ,some bigger than others, but it was a pretty good size for each. 

I don't recommend the soft shelled crab (just cause I'm not into that, but maybe the rest of my table would disagree with me).

We had happy hour sushi..

So I couldn't find some on the menu but one interesting one was Mango Tango (no seaweed), the wrapper was cucumber, and there was mango puree on the plate. It wasn't great, but it was interesting.

This was the place were I had my first hot sake experience, so it'll always be memorable.
author: Lilian L.

description: Service was good and fast. Has a nice ambience to it. The rolls are on the small side - bit overpriced for the quality unless you visit them during their happy hour.
author: Susan L.

description:
Decent for happy hour - $3 beers, $4 wines and $5 appetizers.

The sushi, however, is nothing special. It's not particularly fresh, not particularly flavorful and not particular melt-in-your-mouth-y. 

I would definitely not come here for a sushi dinner (too many great sushi establishments in the city to do such injustice to my belly). However, I would continue to come here for happy hour as it's close to a lot of my friends and their happy hour specials are definitely enticing. 

I recommend ordering the firecracker balls and the sake mojitos. However, if you're feeling a little risque, the sake bombs serve as a great opener for Friday nights. 

Enjoy!
author: Priya S.

description:
What brought me here was a co worker who ha a birthday to celebrate with our team!

Here's what I had:

FIRE CRACKER BALLS - $9
Deep fried tuna roll served w/house special sauce, scallions and sesame seeds.
This was really good!  I am a fan of sushi rolls that comes with a spicy mayo sauce!  I love the combination of soft rice that is deep fried in this crunchy roll with the perfect amount of spice!  Oh and scallions..I love scallions.

I could have ordered another one but I figured it would be healthier to order something else, which was:

HAPPY LUNCH BOX  - $7.95
+ Teriyaki Salmon - when this came out it looked like a tiny portion, but turns out this rich and tasty fish was just enough!
+ CA rolls - can't really say much of this...it's a pretty generic selection of rolls that tastes the same everywhere, which was good!
Salad - I ate the heck out of this because I love miso dressing.

Overall I had a great experience eating here. I'd define toy come back for lunch and maybe try this place for dinner.
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: Our go to sushi!!! Always delicious and fresh! I wish they had a bit more of a variety of rolls, or changed up some of their selection. But otherwise a good neighborhood spot and very friendly service!
author: Drea L.

description:
I've only been here twice and every time it's always empty. That's why it's really surprising to read some reviews saying it's always pack in here! Guess depends on the time you go. For some reason, there's a lot less people during lunch that you can just walk-in and get seated right away! 

To be honest, there's nothing special with the ambiance of the place. Customer service is good, everyone says hello when you come in even those kitchen staff! Place is clean. They have two rooms, one where the bar is and then the big room. 

Our food didn't took that long either to arrive (again, it really depends on what time you come). Food is great! I don't eat those hardcore raw sushi but my family does and they seem to always enjoy their food! Everything looks fresh too! I just wish their miso soup is free because some places offer it for free, but here it only comes with certain food that you order. Also, the chicken in chicken katsu tasted like it was in the freezer for a long time. It didn't came out moist and juicy like what we were expecting. 

Overall, good service and food is delicious! Price is not that bad at all for a sushi :)
author: Mia O.

description: I've had deliveries from Naked Fish 3 times in 2 weeks so far. (Yes, it's that good!:)) It has not disappointed me once, or maybe I should say I was actually pleasantly surprised when I had my first delivery. The sashimi and sushi are always fresh, and the salmon teriyaki is so delicious which makes me think if it taste this good for delivery, it must be incredible if you eat it in the restaurant. I will find time to go there for sure!
author: carol w.

description: Always always fresh yummy sushi! One my favorite sushi spots in SF! The uni is so good!
author: Izzy A.

description:
Great happy hour.  Sushi is decent but hey $3 dollar big bottles of Sapporo beer makes everything just so so much better.

The interior is pretty drool but you're not there for the Picasso on the wall.  You're there for cheap sushi.

It's a regular haunt for me.
author: Edward M.

description:
The hype is so real. Naked Fish is one of those places that stays consistent. I've yet to be disappointed by the food/service. I know there are a lot of competitors out there, but so far I like Naked Fish the best.

First of all, it is very innovative. The decor modern and vibrant. It's cozy and I feel at home when I'm here. As for the fish, it is ALWAYS fresh and pretty much perfect. I've had some of the best california rolls here. LITERALLY MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. Actually I love everything here. It is worth every single penny.
author: Percy R.

description:
My friends and I love going to Naked Fish, especially for happy hour! 

Hands down one of the best happy hours in the city! 
And the employees are amazing. Especially Annie and Ray! 
If you are looking for a good, reasonably priced place to get sushi in the Marina this is the place. 

Just a sample of the happy hour:
Large bottle of Asahi, Sapporo, or Kirin $4!
Hot sake $3!
5 oysters $5
Soft shell crab $5
Hand rolls $3
Rolls $4

Peeps...its amazeballs!
author: Carolyn H.

description:
I usually don't go to the same place twice, because they are so many great places to try and eat at in San Francisco. But this hands is my favorite go to sushi restaurant in SF, especially when I am meeting up with friends in the city. 

Every appetizer and roll I have ever ordered there is spot on delicious! They have good vegetarian options too. Their prices are right on too, and the happy hour prices makes this place even more of an amazing deal! 

The main reason I don't give it a five star is the service. Yes, they are nice and polite, but they can be a little slow and forgetful of items you ordered. If you can get over that, and love sushi, then you will definitely love this place as much I do.
author: Sonia A.

description:
My boyfriend and I come here about twice a month. It's located in the beautiful marina area of San Francisco. They have an awesome happy hour that keep us coming back! Prices are low for what you get. 

Service hasn't always been the greatest but feel they have hired more because of that. They have forgot my food a few times.

Seafood is always fresh and they serve the best avocado rolls if you're a vegetarian.
author: Michlle B.

description: It was underrated. We thought it was amazing everything was so fresh. The bento boxes were a great deal
author: Julie O.

description: If you happen to be on Chestnut Street in San Francisco especially between the hours of 4:30pm and 6pm, this place is a must do. Their happy hour is unbeatable for sushi in the city and service very attentive. The quality of the fish is delightfully fresh and the ambiance pretty mellow. Their oysters on the half shell are from WA and being an oyster fanatic, I can say that these are awesome, albeit on occasion a tad smaller than I prefer. Sometimes, size does matter ;) The rolls are fabulous, every one of them, order to taste. My particular favorite is the Sub 1000: "Fuji apple, cucumber & jalapeño roll topped with buttery escolar (Walu) served with cilantro - jalapeño vinaigrette." They forget to mention the beads of Tobiko which add to more than just aesthetics. Throw on a touch of wasabi and this is nothing short of sushi heaven. Lipstick lady drops 4 kisses XXXX :b
author: Bean C.

description: Fast service, fresh oysters, lover their salmon avocado roll. Came here on Sunday night and didn't wait for a table. Food was served in 7 minutes after order. Nice choice of special rolls.
author: Olga R.

description:
Naked Fish is still my favorite for a long lunch break while in the Marina.

Even with a little slip up - was served teriyaki beef instead of chicken; no problem they took it back and fixed it - I'm still impressed with the quality of the food and great price of $7.95 for a lunch bento box. 

This time for my choice of two items I had the aforementioned chicken teriyaki and the 4 piece California roll. The chicken is still really tasty, with that nice grilled char on the outside, and the California roll was a nice size and full of tasty crab and avocado. I overheard one girl order her bento with double salad, no rice and I think I'll do that next time! The portion size really is not skimpy in the slightest. You WILL leave full!
author: Liz G.

description:
Since I came in here for their Happy Hour menu.., their sushi & beer were at a great price!  The unique thing was that I didn't come here during the middle of the week.  I came here on a Sunday, as they have Happy Hour for 7 days a week.

Other than that.., there wasn't anything special about their food items.  If I came here during their normal priced hours.., then I probably would only give them a 3-star rating.  Their quality of their food was just "okay", but definitely worth the discounted prices.  If you come here for their Happy Hour, you will be satisfied with their beer & sushi selections!
author: Johnny W.

description:
This is not the best sushi that you'll ever have, but it is very respectable, with a great selection and awesome prices (happy hour prices are basically unheard of).  Beyond the traditional stuff I would definitely recommend the crispy fish tacos, which arent at all what I was expecting but great.

The decor / layout is a bit odd, but not in a way that detracts at all from the solidly good food at a reasonable price. 

This is not where you should go to propose to your SO or celebrate your parents 25th wedding anniversary, but you won't be disappointed by the food.
author: Zack H.

description:
I really like this place - it's becoming a new favorite go-to! It's in a fantastic location - on a cute part of Chestnut so there are lots of shops, cafés, bars, etc. for you to go to before or after. Also near the water. And the best part is that the prices and quality are great!

I've been here multiple times and have had their salmon, trout, bluefin tuna, tai, tamago, hamachi, 49er roll, etc. A lot of nigiris are 2 pieces for just $4, and on top of that you get 15% off for checking in on Yelp! Even if it's not "oh my god, this is hands-down the most amazing fish I've had in my life," it's definitely really good, always solid, and the service is always good! And even though the front of the restaurant is small, they have a way bigger back part that's really nice so you won't have to wait!
author: Cynthia W.

description: Naked Fish does raw fish right! Absolutely amazing sushi. One of my favorite sushi spots in the Marina hands down. The rolls were amazing, we got a variety and all of them were fresh and delicious. One that really stood out was the Red Caterpillar. Great customer service and the perfect mood lighting. Great place to go with ugly fiends, the lighting makes everyone look mysterious and attractive. Overall this place is the bomb and definitely 5-star worthy! I will be back without a doubt. I heard they have amazing happy hours as well and I can't wait to check that out next time.
author: Allie B.

description:
Came here with a friend for happy hour dinner. 

The place is a favorite of my friend's and I had never been - and coming it's a pretty good place. Trendy looking, but decent sushi. 

Got there pretty early and got seated. Ordered a glass of wine which was good. 

We ordered a couple of things - calamari, salmon nigiri, autumn delight, rainbow roll, salmon sashimi tartar, and mango tango. 

The only couple of things that were different from what I normally get is the autumn delight and the mango tango.  Autumn Delight is tuna, albacore, avocado lightly tempura seared and served with lemon ponzu. The sushi itself was good and the ponzu is a great addition to the sushi. The mango tango is snow crab, mango wrapped with cucumber, served with mango wasabi sauce & tobiko. It's definitely differently and kind of like a dessert sushi. I did really enjoy it. 

Overall, a pretty good place. Happy hour prices are good and definitely will be back soon with friends.
author: Nina Y.

description:
More like 2.5 stars...

I really don't like giving bad reviews, but since I heavily rely on Yelp, I'd rather be as honest as possible. 

I came here with 3 of my girlfriends last night because the birthday girl was craving sushi. We each ordered a couple of rolls, some appetizers and of course, sake. The rolls were... Ehhh ok, nothing special. Unfortunately, 2 of us became became sick just an hour after eating. Honestly, I don't eat anything raw so I'm not sure what went wrong. I had their mango snow grab in cucumber roll and their version of the lion king roll. My friend that also became ill had a raw fish in his rolls, so that makes more sense. 

The service was also... Nothing special. It's unfortunate that we didn't have a good experience here since we are in the area often. Would I recommend this place? Unfortunately, I wouldn't.
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Went there for dinner, very pleased.

Wide variety of rolls, classic and house special. Fresh and delicious fish. Fast, courteous service. Intimate ambience if you get a table in a cubicle.
author: Stacy A.

description: So gross don't do it man. The food and service are equally as bad. Sashami salad was the worst ever. I asked the guy to bring the appetizers out first. What did he do? Brought it out last with the Miso soup. What a dumb ***. Then I asked where the bento box was and he said, "you still wanted it?" Wow. That's all I can say.
author: Rachel J.

description: Walked in unplanned to kill time before our dinner reservation at Isa across the street and ended up having the best delicious and cheap happy hour! Delicious & cheap definitely = HAPPINESS!
author: Jenny T.

description: Love this place! Management is top notch. According to yelp, my review is too short thus I'm adding this needless verbiage to ensure that Naked Fish gets the review they deserve. 29 stars!
author: Nick M.

description:
Oysters were fresh &delicious..

Ordered their signature roll and it wasn't my cup of tea.. The soy paper was chewy and the roll itself wasn't a "special roll"
author: Julie X.

description: To be honest service is good BUT when it comes to sushi, just walk away. Even basic rainbow roll that is consistant with all places but NO this one had imitated crab inside, no avocado, and topped with tiny pieces of tuna and yellow tail. I would have to say walk away. You are better of spending your money at super duper that is near by, at least you get consistency.
author: Alena N.

description:
I really like this place. We came on a Friday night with a reservation and it was pretty crowded but we and a nice table with plenty of room. I got a cherry blossom roll, a miso soup, and my boyfriend and I split an appetizer of calamari. All was very tasty! I also LOVE that they have edamame on the table for you (similar to bread at an italian or american restaurant).

Will definitely be coming here again.
author: Alexandra W.

description: This is the fourth time I came here... My four stars just dropped to two.....I ordered take out and found some surprises in the food and soup.......a small piece of hair.... And a blue thing in my soup that looked like a rubber band...
author: Nancy L.

description:
Still the best vegetarian sushi selection within a 2 block radius of my brother's place. I ordered the garden roll with cucumber, avocado, asparagus, and spinach this time around. So fresh! A great, light dinner.

A nice, intimate dine-in space, as well. People complain it's small...but what sushi place in the Marina isn't? Yuzu, Ace Wasabi's, Atami, etc are all quaint and cozy. It's part of the SF sushi deal.
author: Mansi A.

description:
Came here this past Saturday with the Sis and Bro.in.Law after a grueling yoga session at AHA Yoga... since the Marina crowd was out in force (ie: drunks at 1 pm) we had to get off the street asap to avoid them... we came here due to hunger and annoyance of the street crowd.

It was dead inside... perfect.

We all sat at the bar so that the sis could watch golf on TV... I don't know what the bro.in.law and the sis ordered (they both eat raw stuff so they ordered those) and since they both consumed everything... it's safe to assume that they liked it.

I on the other hand... can't consume raw stuff... those I ordered the following:

- tamago = their egg is really sweet and I'm definitely a fan! 

- avocado + cucumber roll = tasted really fresh and light... 

- veggie tempura roll = I think that's the name of it but it was delicious! I'm planning on coming back there just for this roll... I think it had asparagus and something else that I liked... deli-sh. 

Overall: service was prompt considering there were hardly any patrons inside... but the food that I ordered I liked so I might just go back here with the S.O....
author: Cath M.

description:
I use to love this place, but my recent visit made me feel dizzy and sick. 

What I liked about this place is that they offered a good happy hour with a decent selection and good prices. The special sushi rolls are 25% off, regular sushi and sashimi are under $5, appetizers are about $5, then beers and sake are half off. 

When I use to eat seafood, I ordered their fried calamari which was crispy and slightly spicy. I loved the fried jalapeno peppers mixed in with the calamari and flakey, brown crusted batter. But with my recent visit, it was nothing like that. I did not eat it, but my aunt, who also loved this dish was very disappointed. It was just a regular calamari dish you can get anywhere... the specialness to it was lost.

At my recent visit, I ordered the grilled eggplant. This was my first time trying this dish and my first reaction was... it was tasty and just how I like my eggplant, but after having the third one my lips were so oily! I ended up asking for napkins, not just to wipe my lips but to soak the eggplant in the napkin! When I think of grilled, I don't think of it as being doused in oil. It was pretty disgusting... to the point of me feeling sick after eating it, I was dizzy, and felt like puking. It didn't help either that I also ate their veggie tempura which was so oily I peeled off the batter. 

As for the sushi, my aunts weren't raving about it. If you just want to get a cheap sushi fix in the Marina, then you can definitely get that at Naked Fish during their happy hour with some beer or sake.


I doubt I'll be coming back here since my last experience did not turn out so great. But if you just want to go to an okay, cheap place for sushi/beer/sake happy hour then this place would be a great place to visit. Though, I would recommend just going to the other delicious food spots on Chestnut!
author: Aiza B.

description:
Take the money and run.

Classic rock song: www.youtube.com/watch?v=-WCFUGCOLLU

Classic sushi roll: Show Me The Money would have been great with just scallops and snow crab. Topped with seaweed it is exceptional.

Almost as good was the Tasmanian Salmon Tower. Baked in honey and served with grilled asparagus in a mango sauce. Fish was great. Mango was a bit bland.

Complementary edamame greeted our arrival. Service was prompt and fast. Couldn't believe everything was less than $25 before tip.

Take your money and go.
author: Jason B.

description:
Came to Naked Fish on a whim -- I craved sushi and I happened to be in the Marina. 

The restaurant wasn't full from what I could see, yet the staff seemed a little disorganized as the two of us waited in the entrance for a little bit too long. The remainder of the service was short, under-involved, under-excited, and seemed to just want to get us out of there. We received one dish that we didn't order, which confirmed the feeling of disorganization. Plus the darned telephone was exploding the whole time -- there is usually nothing that can distract me from putting sushi in my mouth, but the phone was so impressively loud and unattended that it was disruptive. 

While the service was lacking on this particular occasion, the food made up for it somewhat. The seaweed salad and miso soup were great, and I really enjoyed both. We had some rolls that were good -- although I can't particularly remember what they were. We ordered salmon sashimi, but unfortunately were disappointed by the mealy consistency. It was the first time I didn't finish a sake sashimi order. 

Overall aspects of our meal were satisfactory, while others were sub-par.
author: Chelsea B.

description: This is a cute little sushi spot right on Chestnut in the Marina that my friend took us to. I loved that it was really easy to get a table here. Frequently that is a challenge in the Marina. They had cute little intimate tables so it was a great place to catch up. The sushi was good. We enjoyed our rolls and the edamame. That being said, I haven't been inspired to go back. There are so many good sushi places around that this one just couldn't tear me away from.
author: Kari G.

description: Good range of sake. Sashimis are fresh and very good. But this is an average sushi place  with a bit of an awkward sitting area arrangement (bar is on one side and the tables are on the other) and there is a TV which you can't avoid.
author: Khash S.

description: Having been for half an dozen or so times, mostly for happy hour but not always. Here is the thing, Retail Therapy is literally next door to Naked Fish. They carry Catherine Malandrino dresses like nobody's business. I like shopping, sushi and a little bit of running. Combining all three this becomes a heaven sent. It's location location location. My girlfriend lives right by Ace Wasabi, I used to go there a lot for dates, thus not exactly my go to place even though it's right next to it. I like Naked because it's less crowded, no historical memory attached, and I like the seating by the window at the very front for some excellent people watching. I met some interesting people there. Once a very friendly Mexican lady chatted up with my girlfriend and I. We shared a bottle of hot sake. Last weekend a friend of mine and I finished hiking in the city and drove over to see my girlfriend and we ended up there after my Catherine Malandrino fix. That was pretty fun. All in all, a great neighborhood sushi bar, not exactly the best of the best but I really can't think of anything off top of my head around there in the Marina that is significantly better, and you really do feel that you get some decent fish there with quick and friendly service. If you ask me where to go and grab sushi in the city, my mind always seems to wonder over to Naked Fish.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Were passing by this place and decided to check it out! 

Service is very fast, whoever takes care of you will hustle to get things to the table which is great! At least, that's what we felt. Food was fine (we had firecracker roll and smth else - forgot what it was), good tasting, fresh but nothing outstanding. Prices were very reasonable (I'd say cheap!); I got so full from edamame appetizer they bring on the house I couldn't even get to sushi LOL 

Overall, definitely recommend this place. We will certainly stop by again next time we're around.
author: Adeline F.

description:
My friends and I were in the Marina and decided to have HH somewhere before dinner. Luckily we stumbled upon this GEM on a Saturday where beers and sake are all $3 , appetizers (including fresh oysters ) are $5 and sushi rolls are all $6!!
Perrrrrrrrrfecccct! We ordered fresh oysters, deep fried oysters and spicy calamari ,Sapporo and hot sake all for $34.95! Our waitress was also very helpful and friendly!!

Would definitely come back here for HH and try their rolls !!!
author: Claudine V.

description:
Service was fast, they weren't necessarily kind or rude, but a bit indifferent. 

Food was delicious except for one roll and unfortunately I can't remember the name.  However The Naked Roll and Sunset Roll I highly recommend.

Also the Sake!
author: Krishna P.

description:
I have never written a yelp review for a restaurant, but this meal was so bad I feel like doing it this time is a public service. I feel sorry for the people working here, the service wasn't terrible, but the food was really bad. We got a hamachi maki roll, a salmon maki roll, fried calamari, miso and a hamachi kama. Pretty simple stuff, figured it would be hard to mess up too much. 
The fish was all around bad. It had an off smell, and especially when I tasted the salmon roll, I could tell it was bad so I sent that back.  The hamachi kama was poorly cooked, it was mealy, and it had a strange smell. Hamachi kama is one of my favorite things, and I couldn't eat it. When I told the server how bad it was, he said they only source top quality fish. It doesn't matter how nice the fish was when you got it if it is improperly stored. I unfortunately ate the hamachi roll, which resulted in having to call in sick to work today with food poisoning. Don't go here, not even for happy hour. It's just not worth the risk.
author: Shyamali M.

description: Came here after the Divis or Shut Up run with some friends. It was next door and convenient. The wait staff was slow and inattentive. The food was ok, nothing memorable. Lot of other options in the area, this one will not be one of them.
author: Adelina W.

description: Great happy hour, decent food, terrible service. After having 3 messed up orders at our table and a waiter that didn't return 1 time after that to check in (then a 30 min wait for check) - I wouldn't recommend that the pain is worth the great happy hour prices.
author: Ashley M.

description: It is okay sushi.  Not bad, but just okay.  We go every month or so for happy hour.  At those prices, the sushi delivers value.
author: Neil M.

description: Great happy hour w/ so many choices, all at great prices! I hardly ever go to a happy hour for drinks, it's all about the food for me! Their fried baby calamari w/ sweet chili dipping sauce and the "show me the money" roll are my favorites! The best part about their happy hour? They offer it EVERY DAY!
author: Jenny W.

description:
10.31.10

Giants/Rangers, Game 4.  Biffle's birthday dinner.  We took over the bar area beginning at 5:00 and didn't stop until 9:00.

Happy hour ends at 6:00 on Sundays.  We got a ton of orders in before then:
Hot sakes: 2
Large beers: 8
Appetizers: 4
Nigiris: 7
Rolls: 14
Hand rolls: 4

After happy hour:
Cold sake: 1
Hot sakes: 3
Large beers: 2
Mojito: 1
Soft shell crab: 1
Chirashi: 2

Most of the fish were fresh and high quality.  I'd skip the ones with avocado - they come out brown :(

The staff is friendly, very helpful, and presents a casual but professional atmosphere.  Like!

Total damage: $256.25, split amongst 8 (+ birthday boy).
author: Jenny L.

description: Super super slow - even just sitting at the bar. Took 20 minutes for a glass of wine and at 40 mins I still hasn't gotten my food. They do not prioritize customers who are in the restaurant.
author: Claire V.

description: What a joke, I've been waiting 1.5 hours for my delivery of 3 rolls. Horrible service when I called to see how much longer they'd be.  I highly recommend not ordering from Naked Fish.
author: Casey-Marie G.

description:
First thing- I LOVE NAKED FISH! 
Second- I am very surprised with all the negative reviews,cuz I am eating there very often and have never been disappointed with the quality of food or service.
My very favorite roll is 49:) I also like the Rainbow roll as well and sashimi are always very fresh!!! So I loooove this place and would definitely recommend it!
author: Aglaya S.

description:
Decided to come here for their food happy hour. The first thing I noticed was that the place is fairly small. We got the last table in the back of the establishment but because it was on the smaller side it was super loud! It must have been take your child to sushi day because it was packed with kids chattering and yelling about. 

The happy hour menu does offer a ton of food items. I must have just ordered wrong because each thing I got was less than satisfactory. 
Things I got:

The ahi tuna with chips and tofu. This was the best thing I ordered but it was teenyyyy. I was hoping it was meal size but nope. Small, small portion. It was the best tofu I've ever had though.

Tuna hand roll. Bleh. Didn't taste like anything special. It was ok.

Deep fried soft shell crab. Yuck. I ate one bite then gave up. It tasted like pure oil! And the meat to batter ratio was so off. Gross gross gross.


My friends did enjoy their rolls so I guess I just need to get a roll next time. Oh and $2 miso soup during happy hour isn't cool!
author: Cesie A.

description:
We really liked this place.  The Tasmanian Salmon really was delectable - if we'd known in advance how awesome it tastes, we'd have ordered the Tasmanian Tower!  We enjoyed the Nigiri Special, Hamachi Carpaccio (oh.beloved yellowtail!), and a lovely ice cream.  Naked Fish has a good selection of wines and beers.  The ambiance, however, falls dramatically short of the serene depiction on their website.  Service was above average. 

Nice place to get a yummy lunch or dinner if you're dropping some money around Union or the Marina.
author: Liana R.

description:
Date/Time:  Wednesday around 1 o'clock.

Parking:  Metered around the block.  Be sure to bring lots of change!  

Area:  Nice neighborhood with lots of interesting shops/boutiques within walking distance. (There's a cupcake/cake place across the street that looked really good!)  Near water and Exploratorium.


EVAN'S THOUGHTS

As soon as you walk in, you immediately understand the aesthetics and look the owners of Naked Fish were trying to go for:  a trendy and simple Sushi Bar. The service was fast and cordial, efficient and welcoming something that can be hard to find in small scale sushi bars like these.

The food was very good.  We ordered an appetizer of Shrimp Tempura Sushi with avocado and cucumber.  The sushi was light and warm, and the shrimp was done well.  Next was the miso soup.  I have been to many Japanese restaurants, but by far this is the best miso soup I have ever had.  For the main course I ordered the chicken teriyaki and the california roll.  Once again another extremely well prepared dish.

Bottom Line:  quaint, modern, delicious, good prices, Naked Fish easily gets 4 stars from me.

******************************************************
MADELEINE'S THOUGHTS

As soon as we looked at the menu I was sold. Lots of sushi roll/ hand roll (whatever that means) options and plenty of non-raw fish options for the average non-raw fish lovin' American. We split a sushi roll (which contains 5 pieces of sushi) and got the lunch box special which came with an order of rice, miso soup, and two entrees-mackerel and gyozo (japanese fried potstickers) for me. Everything was great but the mackerel. I mean, it was great, until I realized that mackerel has about a million tiny bones in it. Made it very difficult to eat with chopsticks (though I doubt a fork would have helped with the bones). 

The selection of sake (though we did not partake) was large. Seating is not ideal for large groups since most tables seat only 2-3. No dessert options. Booooo (but yay for that cupcakerie across the street!). The entire meal was reasonably priced - the whole meal was $25 for the two of us. All in all - I be comin' back hur.
author: Madeleine H.

description: I wanted to like this place partly because the reviews were so great as well as their amazing happy hour. However, upon receiving our food an immediate overwhelming smell of fish accompanied our sushi. Neither my boyfriend nor I have ever experienced that smell in all of the years of our sushi addiction. Perhaps it was a one time thing but it was stinky non the less. I'm giving it three stars for the large happy hour menu.
author: Maggie S.

description:
Decent. That's the first word that comes to mind when I think of my dining experience here. The food was good, but not necessarily note-worthy. The service was ok, but not great. The atmosphere was nice, but not spectacular. So, decent.

We started with edamame and miso soup. Both were good. Then we ordered 3 rolls to share. We had the Naked roll, Hot Mama Special, and a Tokyo Breeze.

The Hot Mama Special was my favorite. It was a good baked salmon roll, came with 6 generously sized pieces.

The Naked roll was meh. It was decent. But definitely nothing special. Non memorable.

The Tokyo roll sounded great on the menu, but I didn't think that any of the flavors described in the type came out in the roll. Disappointed. 

Overall is was a decent presentation for a decent price. Not sure if I'll be back though as there are other sushi restaurants in the area I'd rather eat at.
author: Krista S.

description:
The last time I came here was when it was under a different owner so I've had fond memories. 
Came on Labor Day. What a mistake! 
Waited at least 30 min for our food. Our lunches comes with miso soup and salad. My sister never got her salad. I did not get my miso soup either. 
I understand they were busy but come on!! 
I've worked in the food industry and service did not have to be this bad even if your super busy. 
We could not get out of there fast enough.
author: Smiley H.

description:
Went for lunch for the first time and, just like dinner, it was amazing. Fresh, high quality fish, reasonable prices, nice location... This is still my favorite place.

We got two sashimi lunch specials (awesome), a naked fish roll (good), and a sprinkle roll (alright but would try something else next time).

This is now my fav spot for lunch sushi, in addition to being my fav spot for dinner sushi.
author: L B.

description:
Here's what I hope for in a sushi restaurant:
a seat at the sushi bar
a chef who has more personality (even slightly) than a post
a server who refills my tea cup at least once in the 65 minutes I'm there
someone to pick up plates after at least 10 minutes (not letting them sit for 30 minutes, please!)
good, fresh fish without an aftertaste to the rice
If you want any of these things, I don't recommend this restaurant for lunch. It may be the hippest place on the block for happy hour, but our experience was dismal. I'll never go back. The only reason for one star is the beautifully cooked hamachi kama that came out of the kitchen. Overall, rude, unpleasant and boring.
author: Linda B.

description:
This place was pretty awesome. We got in right when they opened it was happy hour. Unlike other places their happy hour is every day! Because it was Sunday I was pretty impressed by that. Their happy hour is 4:30 to 6:00 every day by the way.

The sushi itself was pretty good and I had a tasty deep fried chicken appetizer that was also nice. The waitress was very friendly and helpful and overall it was just great.
author: Mark D.

description:
Meh... 

The food was just okay & the service was horrible.  With so many amazing restaurants in San Francisco, they should really get on the ball.  

Happy Hour prices are really cheap though... and that's nice, assuming the wait staff doesn't screw up your order.
author: R. B.

description: I work down the street so I go to Naked Fish about 2-3 time a month. The food is always good but the service is very slow.
author: Robynn J.

description:
my go-to sushi place in the Marina. 
fresh, quick and great ambiance (hello, mood lighting)
very low-key for the most part -- great for small-medium sized parties 

favorites:
Giants roll; spicy scallop, snow crab roll topped with Hamachi, salon, tobiko with spicy mayo sauce
cherry blossom; fresh salmon, hamachi roll topped with spicy tuna & bonita flakes
49er Roll; snow crab, avocado roll topped with fresh salmon and thinly sliced lemon
*Age Dashi Tofu - delish! the textures in this are great -- tofu is always slightly fried & the bonita flakes add an extra crisp.
author: Kat L.

description:
HAPPY HOUR! I always come here for their happy hour and not for their drinks. Rolls are 25% off, maki for $3, handrolls for $2 and nigiri for $1.50. I think appetizers are $5 too. You can have an awesome fulfilling sushi dinner for 20$! They have a very nice wide selection of nigiri. I also found their sushi to be very fresh especially for the price!
I always make sure I get a mangotini and my oysters when I'm there for happy hour. You just can't go wrong with Naked Fish's happy hour.
Just make sure you know when the happy hour is. I made the mistake of forgetting and called to confirm the happy hour time and they gave me the wrong time. We totally missed the happy hour to our disappointment. But it didn't stop us from eating! 
HAPPY HOUR TIMES: Mon-Thurs 4:30-6:30. Fri-Sun 4:30-6:00.
I've been here multiple times. Their service has been wishy washy. Sometimes we get excellent service and other times their service can be slow with them avoiding eye contact with us. Some of the servers aren't as nice and friendly. We've also been rushed to finish before too. 
The ambiance is very lounge like. The lighting is dim and people often come for happy hour with friends to chat over drinks and sushi. I just wish they didn't rush us out that time since this restaurant is a great place to go to play catch up or a girls night out.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Come here for Happy Hour. There is no other way to really enjoy this place other than during happy hour. From 4pm-6pm: $3 beers, $2 nigiri sushi, $3 maki rolls, $2 hand rolls and $5 appetizers. 

Hardly a wait during happy hour which is always great. They don't skimp on the sizes of the rolls or fish. I can easily eat here everyday without putting a dent in my wallet.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
So my friend and I decided to finally try out this sushi place on 5/11/12 Came in on a warm sunny Friday for late lunch. it was "OK'. meaning ok enough not to go back to. We've had better and excellent service from other sushi places in the bay area.

Got sat down by this lady server. Told us to pretty much get our orders ASAP coz we came 30 mins before closing
HELLO? why are you rushing us?  I once walked in 5 mins before closing at SENDAI sushi in MILPITAS and they served us like superstars! SENDAI SUSHI has WAY BETTER SUSHI TOO! YELP IT!
So that really put us in a sour mood...her behavior as well was disappointing.
She didn't check back on us like a normal server would. Especially if you cared enough to get good tips. I understand that you wanted us to get done right away but that doesn't mean we shouldn't get the right service. I really wished I could read your name on your name tag miss lady server. (asian, brown hair, ponytail..wish I had better identifiers)

Also, my friend noticed that the business couple next to us received waaaayyy more sushi than us. (rip off?) But at that point I really didn't care anymore. Service enough was bad. Why should I expect the best sushi ever? just average sushi.

SKIP IT!
author: Faye C.

description: I have always thought I'd never trust 'delivered sushi' but after about four times now with these guys I am convinced it's ok!!! Great food and service!
author: Kirk M.

description: Good food! satisfies your taste buds in every way..Tried sushi in couple of places but none were so yummy like Naked fish.. Must try if you are sushi lover.!
author: Yv S.

description:
LOVE Naked Fish!

They have an amazing happy hour - so cheap!!! 3 dollar maki cut rolls, 2 dollar hand rolls and 1.50 Nigiri! Can't really get better than that. 

Fish has always been super fresh and cut well.

Shrimp Tempura Maki & Handroll - substitute Soy Paper instead of seaweed is my favorite!! 

Get there before 6 for the happs !
author: Tara W.

description:
If you couldn't tell by my reviews, I love to visit sushi restaurants, particularly in the Marina District. Naked Fish is mediocre - their fish is ok but not as good as other restaurants in the area. Although, I do appreciate their happy hour because they have good deals on food & drinks. It's also one of the few sushi restaurants in the area that has lunch, so +1 for that! 

Since the restaurant experience is simply ok, I normally reserve this location for only two situations: Lunch or Happy Hour. I wouldn't find myself going to a full dinner on a weeknight just because there are other restaurants that are a little bit better. Also, this isn't a very large restaurant, so it's not ideal for intimate conversations unless you're lucky to get the side tables.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Naked Fish is one of my favorite Sushi restaurants in San Francisco. Their specialty rolls are delicious, with really interesting and unique combinations of fillings. My favorites are the Marina Angel and the Dragon Roll...with the Veggie Dragon Roll coming in close behind and filled with sweet potato, avocado and other yummy things. Oh, and the 49'ers and the Giants are both amazing as well, and I'm not even a Football fan!

I go here about once a week and always take friends when they're in from out of town. They have a great sushi happy hour with discounted sushi before 6.30pm Mon-Thurs, and before 6pm on Fridays, although they don't have the full menu on the happy hour menu which is a pity, particularly since some of my favorites are not offered during happy hour. I love sitting at the bar cos then you can watch the sushi chefs prepare the sushi and I always meet someone interesting when I'm there on my own.

I took a group of 12 people there for my birthday over the summer and it was perfect for a party. It's never too busy but still has a nice sociable and mature atmosphere, and the service was good. We had a large table through the back and they made sure we were well looked after. It's really easy to share all the sushi if you order lots of different things so it's a perfect location for a group.

They also have a huge menu of cooked food so even if you're not a sushi fan, there's something for everyone. Beware though, if you're in a group over a certain number of people (not sure how many), they add on 15% service charge. I didn't realize that until I got home and checked my receipt again and then realized I'd paid them another large tip! They were super cool when I called back and they had the double service charge removed with my credit card company. It took a week or so to remove it, but they sorted it with patience and persistence.

I highly recommend Naked Fish to anyone looking for delicious food, friendly staff, excellent service and a fun and mature atmosphere.
author: Sally M.

description:
Really not sure why people give this place a good rating. Maybe because it's trendy?

The sushi was terrible. They try to hide the flavor of their subpar fish by dressing up their sushi. It was honestly one of the first places in SF, since moving here, that I was thoroughly disappointed with. We almost returned the food but we felt bad. When we mentioned something to our server, very nicely, he was smug about it and we continued to get bad service. This place is not a quality sushi spot. Maybe it's ok for drinks, but can't speak from experience on that.
author: Kyle W.

description: The service was terrible, I had to wait 40 minutes before I got my food and this was during a slow lunch hour and there  were not that many people. The tori udon was bland and I've definitely experienced better.
author: Ni N.

description: Some of the best sushi I've ever had! Definitely recommend a reservation, the hamachi carpaccio delicious! Great selection of classic and inventive rolls, their happy hour looks interesting !
author: Michelle Q.

description: I'm a hugeee sushi fan but I must say I was a little disappointed by this place. My friend and I came here for lunch on Sunday because it was the only place in the Marina that was open at 2 pm and we were really craving some sushi. The house salad was pretty good but I got the spider roll and it really wasn't anything special. Especially compared to other sushi restaurants in the area. It wasn't bad or anything it just wasn't that good. Our food did come out pretty fast but other than that I don't have a whole lot to say about it. I probably wouldn't go here again.
author: Neilu A.

description:
I always find myself comparing Naked Fish to Ace Wasabi's because they're so relatively close in distance, and although I love both restaurants respectively, I do always find myself at Naked Fish instead. 

I've only come here during their happy hour specials and I'll probably keep it that way. It's 25% off specialty rolls and they have a fairly decent selection. I've tried nearly all of the happy hour rolls and can't complain about any of them. The fish always taste fresh and perfectly rolled. Their sushi tartare appetizer....GAME OVER. The ambience is very fashionable too. I personally like to sit at the sushi bar but it is usually filled up by the time I arrive, so if that is your thing arrive early. 

Great spot. Will definitely continue dining here.
author: Maegan T.

description:
I'm sorry but this is not the best sushi. Its cheap which is a plus but thats about it.

Good for groups, and its more of a sushi place you go with your friends and do saki bombs. I do like that they don't charge for edamame.
author: Jess O.

description:
I came here with a friend for lunch after taking a nice jog through the Presidio. After searching forever for parking, we finally made our way in and were immediately seated at the bar. Our waitress brought us our waters and offered anything else to drink, but especially after having just exercised, we stuck with our waters.

We took a look through the menu and after seeing the selection they had, I figured it would be best to stick to their rolls since they didn't offer much else. Maybe I overlooked it, but I didn't even notice any lunch specials. Between the two of us, we ordered four rolls: the spicy tuna roll, the spider roll, the hot mama special (from their specialty rolls section), and the another specialty roll that had a honey sauce on top of it (I forgot what it was called...). 

The spicy tuna came out first, and it looked pretty typical. It had a nice amount of heat to it, though it could have been slightly spicier. Next was the hot mama special. It was a little hard to pick up each piece because the rice kind of stuck the pieces together, but it was really tasty. The salmon had a nice texture to it and the sauce was amazing. Finally, the spider roll came out. It was pretty good, but nothing super special. The last roll came out with a small dollop of honey sauce on each piece. I thought honey would be a weird addition to sushi, but it made it nice and sweet. It was a good contrast to the rest of the sushi piece. 

Our waitress was attentive (granted, there were only a few other customers there), refilled our waters as needed and cleared our empty sushi platters.

For approx. $20/each (including tip/tax), it was a pricey lunch. I likely won't come back just because it was so expensive and while their specialty rolls were really good, I would be fine trying a less expensive place with lunch box options (I like getting the miso soup and salad included in my meals).  However, I'm glad I tried it at least once because they had some unique rolls. This is a good place if you feel like having some really good specialty rolls and don't mind splurging a bit. Otherwise, I would stick to the sushi classics like sashimi and basic rolls at a different place.
author: Leana L.

description:
If you are looking for a decent place in the Marina to have sushi and not pay a lot, then this place is good. There is a reason they have SUPER cheap happy hour everyday for 3 hours. like hand rolls are $2.
I called a few days ago to place my To-Go order and the first 3 things on my order they didn't have so I had to look over the menu again and change my order. By the way, the things I wanted were usual sushi place things like Hamachi Nigiri. Also they don't make it clear that not all rolls are available at lunch time. only about 7 rolls are available at lunch times.
Anyways when I came to pick up my order, the place smelled SUPER fishy. Like a Asian fish market. Then it took about 5 minutes for the guy to come back with my change. 
Overall the food was ok. The rainbow roll was a little too fishy for my liking though. but for cheap once in a while at work sushi, its definitely ok.
author: G O.

description: Convenient location, cool name, I had the Firecracker roll, it was so-so. Waited about 10 minutes at the door just to be acknowledged and seated, and I was by myself! I have yet to find a good sushi place in SF!
author: Jules C.

description:
In the Marina, where the epitome of beauty lurks within the streets. A man glares out of the window of a restaurant to admire the tender bottoms that bounce by. Only to be tapped by his mistress sitting across the table, "hey a-hole, eyes over here.."  I've been meaning to commend this Nudey fishy for a while now, I believe it's finally time. 

They have the most excellent happy hour with rolls that are very reasonably priced (430-630pm). $3.00 for 6pcs. maki roll, $2.00 hand rolls, 30% off on signature rolls, whoa! The Dragon roll is always good, spicy salmon with some saracha tingles the taste buds and a spicy tuna hand roll tastes ever so fresh. Total bill being $20.00 for a dinner for 2, where both parties are comfortably full, hell to yeah-ya. So the presentation of the sushi isn't the most extravagant, but sometimes you just need simple, but fresh tasty sushi to fill that craving. Nakey Fishy you've done me well. Don't put your clothes back on.. yet ;)
author: Sani S.

description: I'm not sure why Naked Fish doesn't have better reviews. My husband and I love this place; it's an easy go-to right over the bridge from Marin and they have a great happy hour on weekdays. Have I had better sushi? Absolutely. Do I still always enjoy Naked Fish? You bet!
author: Ashley R.

description: I have ordered take out from Naked Fish probably 50 times. I've dined in there maybe 20 times. Typically their sushi is pretty good. Not great, but definitely above average, and it's conveniently located for me so I order from them a lot. With that said, tonight their take out sushi was really bad. I am a pretty simple guy and we order basically the same thing every time. Teka Maki is very basic. Raw tuna and rice. Usually the tuna quality at Naked Fish is pretty good. Not amazing, but it's consistently pretty good. Today, it was horrendous. They should not have sold the sushi they delivered to me today. The tuna was damn near white (maybe ever so slightly pink), while it's usually a deep red. We ordered 3 orders of Teka Maki and 1 of the orders was ok but the other 2 were flat out embarrassing and inedible so we threw it all out. The Dragon Rolls and California roll was ok though. I won't order from them again simply because anyone who would sell that quality of fish doesn't deserve my business.
author: Adam P.
