description: A great place for sushi when you're in the mood for something more creative than your usual spicy tuna and california roll.  Rolls are priced 6-12 and some were definitely better than others. Without booze, we walked out for under $20/person, not bad.
author: Heather C.

description:
This is a perfect example of how flavors can be so subjective - i really can't believe anyone could find this place acceptable "sushi"... but some people have surprisingly offered up pretty good rankings! I however, am way in with Justin G. on this place... decent fish (the sashimi was fine), no idea what to do with it. I don't care how fresh the fish may be once it's been smothered in mayo / deep fried it doesn't matter anymore. I'm not a total purest, but one of the things I love about sushi is being able to taste the fresh, clean flavors and the light feeling of the food --- Naked Fish offers no such experience. I went with a group tonight  (we tried a ton of different dishes, so I feel I can fairly judge the food) and I ended up with such an awful stomach ache, that even though I left still hungry --- because I couldn't fathom eating any more after so much grease had been packed into my body --- I am laying here still awake, hungry and in pain now... it's not food poisoning, just too much oil. Icky. I will never go back.

I give two stars because the sashimi was fine, the service was fine and the sake was fine --- none were great.
author: Hazel Grace D.

description: We went with the staff recommendations of some very creative rolls.  They were surprisingly delicious.  The sub 1000 was to die for.  And I love almost any place with nigori sake.
author: Amme P.

description:
why not 5 stars? just follow the mathematical  equation :

10 people ravenously hungry & in need of some libations after a defeated softball game - slow* waitress + 3 sake flights + 5 sake crafes** +  experimental items on menu + 12 rolls of sushi*** - lacking use of unagi in rolls - does not serve anago + "mood" lighting + spacious bathroom to change from softball clothes to jeans, shirt & heels + reasonable cost after carnage**** - lack of traditional greeting from other sushi locations = 4 stars

* slow = (no fault of business though of individual) 0 + forgotten drink + excess time between sitting & ordering 
** 2 of the 5 labeled "Dragon Slayer" - soooo worth it. i got slayed.
*** some offering orgasmic experiences such as marina angel, sub 1000,  dragon roll & mango tango = +2 stars
**** $36/person including tip.... i can alone can consume $40 including tip. group dining is cheaper in the long run.
author: Madhu D.

description: It's true, with all the fabulous sushi spots in this town, this was far from my favorite. Everything seemed pretty humdrum, the service was so-so, and the vibe of the place was lackluster like everything else.
author: Ana M.

description:
I've always avoided the Naked Fish, because whenever I want sushi, it's late at night and you know what they say about raw fish at the end of the day...

So today I met a friend for lunch.  Our service was speedy which correlated with the fact that there were about 5 people (2 waitresses, 1 sushi chef) in the restaurant.  We ordered spicy scallop and naked fish rolls.  We also got a spicy, fried tuna roll of the "firecracker" variety.  I loved the naked fish roll - the little bit of mint accented the avocado very nicely.  Each roll had 6 pieces, which seemed more generous than other places I've been to.

The restaurant is much bigger than it appears on the outside.  We sat in the back, which had more natural light.  We lingered after the bill came and the waitress was still kind enough to continue refilling our water glasses.

Not quite a "go to" kind of place... but definitely yummy and I'm glad I finally gave this place a chance.  However, I wouldn't really recommend the Naked Fish for people outside of walking distance as parking on Chestnut Street is usually terrible.
author: Lindsay M.

description: This place has really good food. The sushi is fresh and filling. I loved the drinks too. Only problem with this place is the service. I got my rolls befor eI got my drinks. I also ended up waiting for thirty minutes for a table after I was told ten. All in all though this place is funa nd a great place for sushi in the Marina
author: Nina Q.

description:
i am crazy about this place. we usually eat here with friends every friday and i get cranky if i can't make it. i need to get naked on a weekly basis!!! :-)
most of the time we order the same things (miso soup with clams, sashimi, tuna tartare, fried calamari, firecracker balls and poke) and they are always yummm. last time we got a bit tipsy (from their lovely australian shiraz) and kept ordering new dishes for hours.   i am so glad we did!!! everything was fab, the staff didn't kick us out although we spent almost 4 hours there. excellent service, delicious food and great prices. you can't beat that!
author: Oyo S.

description:
I went to the Naked Fish on a recommendation from a friend. The place is not that hard to find, the new sign is much better than the old black awning that the old owners used to have (check yelp picture). I stepped in to the front door and the ambiance was not that bad. They didn't make any cheesy attempts to fill the place with Japanese decor to falsify authenticity (unlike some places in the city that's so phony but i digress). For starters, the edamame was served and its free (unlike most sushi places in SF that bleed you for everything). On to the food.

First off, simple rule of ordering sushi... ask the sushi chef what is fresh or what his specialty is. This has never failed me. I have to say that the fish is pretty fresh (and this comes from a guy who actually fishes and makes his own sushi). The allegations of the fish not being fresh is false. I'm a big fan of beef tataki as well and the chef has prepared it a little differently from what I'm accustomed to but a delicious rendition none the less. I would recommend the Sprinkle Roll or the name sake Naked Fish Roll for people who are open minded to try something different. They served chilled Tradition sake with my meal and it was smooth. The service was top notch. We received our edamame as soon as we sat on the bar. I talked to the sushi chef, introduced myself and I had my order taken right there and then. I didn't really have to wait more than 15 minutes and the bar was full. My overall experience has been great and I would recommend this place to friends who want to try something new.
author: Jojo G.

description: I liked this place, I went awhile back on a chilly saturday with my boyfriend at the time. I felt a little under-dressed as I was in flipflops(albeit nice ones) . Anyhow the sushi although probably not that authentic or great was decent and the decor and the feel was very .  Despite the feeling of being underdressed I thought this place was ok.
author: K T.

description: Solid fresh fish, decent rolls, over-eager service and not usually packed.  $80 for two people with no alcohol but dessert - not terrible.  JAMSB - just another marina sushi bar.
author: Matt S.

description: Went here over the weekend with some friends. The place was only half full since it was Sunday night, but even then, the service was very haphazard. Kudos to the guy who pores the water for keeping me very  hydrated, but what happened to my Edamame? Why did we get some of the rolls we ordered before getting our miso soup? ...You get my drift. The fish in general was pretty fresh. We'd ordered lots of sashimi in addition to some rolls. Also got the seared ahi plate (very good) and the sunset strip roll (cucumber wrapper) which consisted of 4 very tiny rolls... Anyways, in general, this place is not too shabby. Cheaper than Zushi Puzzle and definitely more lively (but not as fun as Mas Sake). I would give the food a 4 and the service (lousy) a three...
author: Pretesh D.

description: Delicious. Fire Cracker Balls + Mochi Lover Dessert = Heaven. 'Nuff said.
author: Esther A.

description: Nothing like hot sake to warm you up during a cold SF nite, esp. at happy hour prices!  Naked Fish has amazing happy hr deals. I had a spicy tuna roll, salmon roll, and 2 carafes of hot sake for $13!  Unbeatable. The sushi was pretty good too. Definitely coming back again.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Came here on a rainy weekend and the ambiance was cool.  Just cool, nothing really eye opening, just cool.  

Anyways, onto the food... Ordered:
Hot Sake - wasn't that hot and I was expecting to gulp a piping hot shot actually since it was so cold outside.  Luke warm at best.
Ahi Tuna Pokki - Excellent dish here that was plated very nicely.  The marinated tuna sashimi was on top of a seaweed salad which was delicious!  Probably my favorite dish of the evening.
Vegetable Tempura - Assorted vegetables deep fried in a light vegetable oil that's served with tempura sauce.  Couldn't go wrong with this dish, it's like ordering french fries at McDonald's - had to.
Raw Oysters from Washington - Sad that our server didn't know specifically where the oysters were from nor the name...  Anyways, they were pretty good, nothing special, I added that sauce they provided along with extra tabasco to make it tastier.
Marinated Ribs - These were cooked on a grill and marinated well.  tasted pretty good and sliced nice and thin.
Soft Shell Carb Appetizer - This was good but not at all jaw dropping where I wanted to request another one.

So overall, the food was okay and pleasing.  Nothing that I was thrilled about.  Anyways, I wouldn't go here again unless I tried all of the other Japanese - Hawaiian restaurants SF has to offer....
author: Limzer L.

description: Now I went on a Thursday night, the place seems standard for sushi..no complaints there...service was good...no complaints...the sushi was just OK...nothing horrible but nothing great...free soy beans!
author: Kevin B.

description: I was really not impressed with Naked Fish at all. Of the two rolls my friend and I shared one was really good and one pretty much sucked. We were lured in by the semi-swanky decor in the front but since we wanted to sit at a table and not the counter we were seated in the back part of the restaurant which seemed kind of boring and run down. Definitely won't be back.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Really good sushi, not the best but still top 5 in the city.   They have awesome spicy rolls.  IF you like spicy, try them!  Service is pretty good and everyone is really nice.  It's also a good place where you can have a convo without shouting.  Also, the deco is pretty nice.
author: Lexie S.

description: My boyfriend and I were strolling along Chestnut and decided to try this restaurant out. I ordered the Ahi Tuna and I forgot what he ordered but the portion was VERY SMALL. I could've taken two bites and finished it. My Ahi tuna came out COMPLETELY cooked and cut in tiny pieces placed on the inside of a tomato. We told our waitress and she was super nice about it. But the ahi tuna took another  40 minutes to come out. We must have been in there for a good 2 hours and half the time was waiting for my ahi to arrive. When it did come out the ahi tuna was tossed onto the bowl without the tomato. We asked them what happened to the tomato and they said they "ran out." The waitress was nice enough to give us edamame and mochi balls on the house but I won't be returning.
author: Vikki K.

description: Their kiwi-steak is a symphony of Hell-F$^%ing-Yea
author: Alex H.

description: Naked Fish is my "default" sushi place in the Marina. It's not the best sushi in SF, but definitely decent. My favorite roll is the hot mama special. The food is very reasonably priced and happy hour is a MUST. I probably wouldn't come here on a Friday / Saturday night but Naked Fish is a great go-to for happy hour, lunch, or if you're in the mood for take out :)
author: Ang H.

description: The sushi here is okay. What i like about this place is that there are very unqiue and creative rolls. The kiwi steak is very delicious and the tasmanian tower also.  The happy hour is also a plus...But not the best sushi in town.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Delicious, delicious, delicious. Need I say more? Some of the best sushi I've had in a while.

However: watery salad dressing, and miso soup needs a bit more kick.

Eat your heart out!...and nice interior, good atmosphere/vibe. Very attentive, friendly waiters.
author: C P.

description: My sister and I used to come here for Happy Hour all the time - until I got soo sick one night after eating there that I thought I saw Jesus.  Since I got sick and Alison didn't, she swore that it wasn't the food so we chaulked it up to who knows.  I hadn't been back since because I get really nervous about stuff like that but last night I thought I would put my big girl pants on and deal with it.  So we hauled ass over there for Happy Hour and showed up about 6 minutes before it was over.  They told us that they were doing last call and we said no problem because we knew what we wanted.  Here's where it gets awesome - they wouldn't take our order.  Even though it was last call and we still had some time (not to mention we knew what we wanted) they told us that we couldn't be part of Happy Hour.  Not only was the restaurant almost empty, they had plenty of sushi chefs to go around.  We stood there confused and asked again. The waitress said no so we turned around and walked out.  Ace Wasabi is a block away, a million times better, and their happy hour goes til 7.
author: Arica V.

description: Firecracker balls - are yummy yummy yummy! I was weary about going to this place after reading yelp reviews. However it was pretty good and actually not that much per person.  The Marina Angel roll was also another group favorite. But definitely do not miss out on the firecracker balls when you go.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Very nice little japanese restaurant.  A couple friends and I came here today an early dinner.  Fortunately, we came here 30 minutes before happy hour ends.  We got 25% off the sushi and got to ordered out of the happy hour menu!  

The 3 of us ordered:
-Firecracker roll:  Must try...very good.
-Oysters:  Fresh...but nothing special...
-Sub 1000:  Ok...taste like a vietnamese dish
-Mango Tango:  no...no....no...
-cherry blossom:  pretty good!
-spicy calamari:  yum...love it!
-Salmon and Unagi Nigiri:  Ok...nothing special
-Soft Shell Crab:  Yummy...
-Spicy Tuna Roll:  Ok...nothing special
-Hot Mama:  very yummy!

I would definately come back for happy hour!
author: Linda H.

description: This place is so nice and the food is good. We tried the Fire Cracker Balls which is a MUST!! It was served on a plate with three kinds of sauce and was delicious. Then we had the Sunset strip which was OK nothing special. We also had the Red Caterpillar roll and Cherry Blossom roll which was also delicious. The fish was fresh too.. The price was OK. It was not cheap not expensive. I guess the price is average. I would definitely go again and try their Hot Mama Roll and their Cannon Ball Roll. The service was pretty good too
author: Juliane N.

description: Best HAPPY HOUR in the city! 3$ large sapporo, $3 large hot sake, $3 rolls, and $2 hand rolls.
author: Katie R.

description: A fun place to eat in the Marina area if you are looking for a  trendy sushi place.  The place is small, but the bar is fun to grab some rolls and people watch.  A light dinner spot so you have plenty of room for the sake.  I am not a sake expert so I usually try out their sake sampler for variety and wash that down with a Sapparo.
author: Sherman H.

description: I am very picky about my sushi.  I have not yet been able to find a place I truly love in the city.  Naked Fish is pretty good though.  I can't give it 4 stars, though, because it is nothing in comparison to Matsuhisa.
author: Angie C.

description: Pretty okay lunch specials and veggie sushi, and the fish seemed fresh enough, too. Got us full for a decent price. Sat at the bar, it's a decent space. The sushi chef was a man of few words. Might go back for a no-hassle lunch on Chestnut if I ever need to take another Pita Pit hiatus!
author: Shannon R.

description: There's nothing that quite beats eating at a place that begins with the word Naked! Add to that uniquely prepared, incredibly yummy sushi; friendly service; great atmosphere that includes good music, and a happy hour 7-days a week! Not to mention, if you felt like keeping the night going, you are surrounded by a plethora of options to do so. How can you go wrong?
author: Gina G.

description: I judge sushi restaurants on one thing: fresh fish. Naked fish had plenty of it, and a nice ambiance too. We sat in the lovely window table.
author: Sahra H.

description: All the fish seemed pretty fresh.  Prices are reasonable, especially the $6 uni sashimi. I don't think the rolls were anything crazy, and definitely were on the more dinky side. I would go back for the happy hour which has pretty good deals on drinks, rolls, and hand rolls. It goes from 4:30-6:30.
author: Peter G.

description: Overall, good service and good sushi. Order the calamari appetizer- it is delicious. My friend's ordered the firecracker balls, and absolutely loved them, though they claimed they were not too spicy! I am picky when it comes to sushi, but their Dragon, Shrimp Tempura, and Veggie Rolls were all very good (and filling). Nice wine selection, as well. It was nice to be able to walk in, sans reservation, and be seated promptly on a Friday night.
author: Laura D.

description:
totally fresh fish
so cold beer
fire cracker balls

what more do you want?

delivery?  that's right, they do that too - awesome!
author: david s.

description: Not the best sushi Ive ever had, but decent. The Happy Hour menu is FANTASTIC though. 3 bucks for a large Sapporo, a buck for each piece of nigiri, 5 dollar appetizers, and 25% off of rolls. So next time you get home early and are looking to get 2 people full and drunk on 30 bucks, try Naked Fish.
author: Alden H.

description: Ok maybe it's not the best sushi in the world.  But I enjoyed myself every time I went there.  I liked the ambiance, the friendly wait staff and even the sushi.  If you do go you must try the firecracker balls....god those are so good!  It's all about creativity there, so one must go with an open mind.  Oh if you like sake try their unfiltered sake!
author: Amanda P.

description: From the outside, it looks like a fast food sushi joint but the inside is a little more trendy.  You can't beat their 25% off happy hour special.  I recommend the Mango Tango.  Plenty of unique choices.
author: La A.

description: i LOVE naked fish!  it is my favorite sushi place. The Naked Fish roll is to die for- I could eat it everyday.  The service is kind of slow if you are not sitting in the back or at the sushi bar because you kind of get left out.  But the few tables by the window are still the best spot.  Warm sun fills the windows and you can see the hustle outside.  Yea, you are going to pay at least $30 for lunch by yourself- but isn't all good sushi expensive?!
author: Shannon M.

description: Lively inventive sushi. Extraordinary flavors, though not extraordinary fish. A good staple, though it's in the marina. Killer happy hour if you want a bargain, and to get in and out quick, and don't need to be impressed.
author: I. V.

description: I love this place.  Fresh fish (the nigiri is always delish though the choices are sometimes limited), inventive rolls (sometimes almost too inventive), and really reasonable prices.  It's definitely my fave marina sushi spot because you can always get a seat easily (ahem, Zushi), and they have a sweet happy hour deal.  Maybe it's not the best sushi EVER, but really, any way you look at it, this is a place to like.
author: Dale M.

description: Hands down my favorite sushi place. All the rolls are delicious- my friends and I ordered three rounds.  The tuna fireballs (or something like that) are great.  There is also a trio of sashimi that is great.  For something cooked, we tried the miso flavored halibut that was really good.
author: Laura G.

description: Best friend and I were looking for a "birthday" sushi place in the marina and we stumbled upon Naked Fish. The best way I can describe this place is average. Happy hour specials were great and by far the best I've seen but the restaurant is pretty small and sushi is about average as is the service. Good drinks though and happy hour apps were OK.
author: J D.

description: In the last few weeks I've gone here twice (hadn't been in like two years). And I have to say, I have been very pleasantly surprised. One Saturday night there, I showed up with a few friends after a long day of day drinking, and I'm sure we must've been obnoxious. But at 10 p.m., it was still bumping in there and the waitress was very, very kind to us! The sushi was great too. Everything was fresh and tasty. I'd definitely pick it over the other sushi places on Chestnut...
author: michaela w.

description: Shame on naked fish.  A $10 dish consisting of two pieces of salmon and asparagus does not count!  (Tazmainian Tower) I'm usually full from two orders of appetizers, but my friend and I had to order seven!!   Whoa, that's a first timer.  My friend insisted the Firecracker balls were so stupendous, she had to have another dish.  Okay, okay.  So one out of seven dishes were decent.  The sake made me sick to my stomach.  Ouch.  Sorry, but i would not recommend going to this quaint little neighborhood for some naked fish sushi.
author: Strawberry K.

description: We had dinner the other night and were really disappointed at the low quality food and average service, especially considering the somewhat high price.  The fish was average to low quality and many of the rolls just lacked that freshness that you expect when going out for sushi.  I'd go to Zushi puzzle on Lombard for high quality, fresh fish.  Bring your own wine or drink beer, cause they ain't got much to pick from.
author: Stephen H.

description: I like coming here when you have no official plans to eat out but are in the mood to eat sushi. I almost always get seated pretty quickly and the service is good. I like their specialty rolls such as the red catapillar. great to come on a mellow night.
author: Erin R.

description: Naked Fish was decent but it freaked me out that the resturant smelled like old fish...gross.  The food itself was good and reasonably priced.  I would go again if there wasn't another option.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Granted I'm new to sushi so don't have much to compare it to, but I went here the other night and was very happy with it. I played it safe and got the california roll and shrimp tempura roll, one was $5 and the other was $6. So in response to whoever says it's very overpriced, I disagree.

The food did take a little while and the 3 dishes came out at totally different times, but I was there to hang out with a friend, not get my food, eat quickly, and quickly leave. 

The restaurant was really cute and I'll definitely go back
author: Caitlin B.

description:
The husb and I came in for dinner at the spur of the moment, which isn't like us.  Usually we like to take an excruciatingly long time to decide where we're going.  Really ups the hunger crank factor, makes for a fun time.  However, with my dad on East Coast time and willing to stay with our sleeping kids, we didn't have time to think - just dashed out, said "We'll be back soon!", and didn't look back.  Oh wait, I do remember a going-nowhere discussion about what type of cuisine we were in the mood for while we were walking, and there was some back-tracking during that walk, so I guess we did employ our usual process while deciding where to go.  Yeah, I was really irritated with the poor guy, but I digress...
We both loved Naked Fish!  We're definitely used to Midwest sushi, where the fish isn't as fresh, the portions aren't as large, and the prices are higher.  So maybe this is just a typical West Coast sushi place, but we really enjoyed our meal.  It was delicious.  Honestly, we were so tired at the time I can't remember all we ordered.  Edamame, a couple apps, and some maki.  No sashimi or nigiri.  We loved it all, though we did over-order because we're used to smaller portions.
author: L T.

description: Although this sushi spot is right near the action in the Marina, it is set back one block from the party crowd which avoids the lines out the door and makes this a more relaxed alternative to Ace Wasabi and Mass Sake.  The place is upscale and trendy with a very friendly atmosphere.  The food was good with the one qualification being that the raw sushi seemed a little dry and maybe not as fresh as it could have been.  However, this is no different than any other of the Marina sushi spots.  In sum, this is a great sushi restaurant for those looking for good food at a trendy restaurant, however, this is probably not the place for the "sushi purist".
author: Devin W.

description:
Personally I think the scene is borderline embarrassing and couldnt ever imagine going on a date there...i.e. blinking SNOWFLAKE lights etc..

But I have to say the food was pretty decent. They have a number of different and original rolls and the fish tastes fresh. I've had better but I've had worse.
author: A. K.

description: Very nice people who work there. I like the big plasma TV at the bar. I was able to watch the game and enjoy the yummy food.  Cool little spot in the middle of Chestnut. I recommend this place........two thumbs up!
author: tom h.

description:
3.5 stars

Zushi Puzzle is closed on Sundays? Oops, decide to try naked fish around the corner.

Seated right away as a walk in for a part of three- excellent.

Appetizer - poke. UMMMM. Negative stars? Pacific catch does a wayyy better poke with lots more tuna for the same price! this came in a martini glass and was basically ALL red onion with maybe 10 small chunks of fish. totally a rip off. not tasty. 

rolls - sunset strip, hot mama and two others. Overall, pretty good. Fish was fresh and tasty

Price: like $100 for three for poke, 4 rolls, and a bottle of wine.


Food: ***
Value: *****
Service:****
Overall 3.5
author: Kay T.

description:
I have read the other reviews rippin' on this place, and I could understand why some could perhaps come to the wrong conclusions (and this stands also as one reason why I don't like this place)... for instance, despite that my first experience here was a good one, there have been two other instances when I came at the wrong time--namely, when the guy who normally makes the sushi put on his half-ass apprentice to fill in. If my first experience had been when this nit-wit was making the sushi, I might have thought less about this place... but even then, my review would have been one less of a star. 
But because I have only that to say as far as the negative is concerned, there is a lot of good to add....
Naked Fish has a dynamic menu full of great rolls and entrees creatively fused to make for an appetizing experience that sets it apart from so many other run-of-the-mill restaurants. Their Flying Philly roll rocks, and their raw fish is good--not too fishy (I don't like eating fish that resonates too much with that of an unkempt female organ, if you know what I mean). Their bento box has never yet been a let down. I like their tempura, it has a hint of sweetness I haven't found elsewhere (except for one other place). The ambiance depends on where you sit... I think the back of the joint is very drab and ordinary compared to the front. But overall it's not bad. The front of the restaurant is fixed with a flat screen, so if you want to watch the game and have your sushi too, it's a safe bet since they usually have it tuned to sports. Or... people watching out the window onto the madness of Chestnut Street on a bustling Sunday can be just as entertaining. Another point that gives this place an unmatched edge to their competition.
author: Mike S.

description: Great sushi at a reasonable price. You can't beat their happy hour pricing. I've been to Naked Fish at least 2 dozen times over the last few years and have never been disappointed. I really like that the back room is never extremely loud, so you can actually have a conversation with the people you are dining with. If you go, you have to try the firecracker balls. They are amazing!!!
author: Lisa P.

description: AMAZING prices at happy hour: a big beer, sake, and 30 pieces of sushi for 25 bucks?  Damn.  Pretty good quality as well.  Trendy techno in the background.
author: Danny C.

description: My boyfriend and I eat sushi at least once a week, and we usually end up at Naked Fish given we live in the neighborhood and can always walk right in.  The sake nigiri is some of the best in the Marina, and they have interesting different Hawaiian nigiri specials.  The main thing we like too is that they have an awesome Happy Hour with 1/2 price sake (the drink not the salmon) and super cheap nigiri, hand rolls, and simple maki.  We recommend the spicy hamachi and sake makis.  Stick to the simple at this place.  Their house special rolls are pricey, and we tried a few and preferred the simple makis.  The fish is always fresh without any fishy taste or smell, so that along with Happy Hour prices is what keeps us coming back.
author: Leslie R.

description: I seriously love this place.  Enough to make it my first yelp review ever!  I wasn't too sure about it at first mainly because it was a friday night and not that packed.  But man was it good and well priced.  The fish is very good.  I eat sushi at least once a week and have had my fair share of good and bad.  I also like the atmosphere and the customer service.  It is small and really has a good vibe to it.  The waiters are all pretty cool.  Drinks and food are all well priced.  They also have a great happy hour which I am dying to go to.  Just can't make it there that early.  Either way I give it a go!
author: Ryan L.

description:
Great Food. Fresh Fish.  Displayed for enjoyment.  Nice People.
A great experience in dinning!  Just don't over eat.
author: Julianna E.

description: The best Sushi I have ever had.  Go for Happy Hour the specials are unbeatable.  Service was amazing.  Atmosphere was casual.
author: John P.

description:
5-Star Sushi, 3-Star Service.  This place is great, but they're perenially poor on service.  Slow, forgetful, you name it you'll hit one of them on any given visit.  

The sushi is excellent.  Creative, fresh, and consistent.  Very good sake menu as well.
author: Ken M.

description: I give this place 4 stars because of the Happy Hour prices. I was accidentally in the Marina on a saturday afternoon, and got a ton of decent fish for super cheap. The menu was small, and there were a few rolls I ordered that were just ok, but you can't go wrong with the nigiri and half price sake. I'd go back if I ever found myself in that area again.
author: Cheryl J.

description:
Nothing special to say except that the food was below average. The sushis, California roll and tonkatsu were all OK but fell short of being great.
On a separate note the velvet bench was disgustingly dirty.
author: Cedrick C.

description: I love naked fish.  You must get The Firecracker balls, Marina Angel and Mango Tango.  Great atmosphere and prices are ok for Sushi.  BUT - it does seem every time I am there - service is a tad slow.  Maybe it's just me.  I often have to flag down the server to give them my credit card.  I keep returning - so clearly this is not a show stopper for me.
author: jason l.

description: This place has the most spectacular happy hour I have ever seen. For those of you who love sushi, big boy sapporos, sake, and quick attentive service this is the place to be from 4:30-6:30. We're talking half price sake and sapporos to accompany your $2 spicy tuna handrolls. I must also reccomend the firecracker balls if I remember correctly that is what they are called. Either way if you get out of work early you can get a lil tuned up and tuned in at this relaxed place with some buds. Definitely worth a peak
author: Michael M.

description: I ordered take out from Naked Fish and...well...it was more than just a little disappointing. I ordered the Hot Mama roll (california roll with baked salmon) & autumn delight (I'm not sure what type of fish this was supposed to be) & the ahi tataki. All of it was sub-par & for $30, I expected a little more.  Won't go here again.
author: Z L.

description:
naked fish is the best value currently in San francisco, period!
every thing I enjoy in a dinning experience is found here:  great chow, suburb service and reasonable price
author: malcolm e.

description: I was here with my friends last week for their happy hour menu and drinks. All I have to say is, WOW! Eric, our waiter was extremely helpful and friendly. He helped us ordered all our foods and drinks right before the happy hr cut-off time at 6pm on a Friday. All their sushi were fresh and the food came fast!!! The restaurant is kind of cozy & crowded on a Friday night, long wait for a huge party but prefect for happy hr with reasonable price, good food and great service!!! Parking can be a pain but still want to come back!
author: Lily L.

description: Really liked this place, everything was fresh and tastefully presented.  It didn't break the bank either.  The bench seating in the back dining room kind of sucks with no real back rest, but whatever, the food was great, service was good, price was reasonable.
author: Kevin I.

description: If you are looking for decent sushi and cute setting this is a good find. Friendly staff, tiny tables/cramped seating (so good thing my friend and I are skinny)...we felt a little plastered to the wall but were forgiving b/c we were each enjoying nice cold sapporos after a long walk in the Marina. Actual sushi was not bad but not out of this world. Spicy tuna hand roll- good, naked fish roll was filling/tasty. Hamachi-ok.  Lots of menu options, price fits the location not quality i think, but I would return at some point for further review.
author: s m.

description:
I am almost reluctant to yelp about this restaurant. We love it!!
We find it delicious, fresh and very reasonable. The service is excellent. The food is creative, interesting and beautifully presented and FRESH.
Staff is very caring and warm and interested in your experience.
The prices are the best around. Happy hour is a deal!
We love the salmon tower--great deal and delicious and presented in a five star manner. All the rolls are delicious. Went last night (we are frequent fliers) and I wish i was there eating now.
author: babyboomer z.

description: Don't waste your time with this place - as the BF aptly said, he would have rather paid two parking tickets then have eaten dinner here.  Everything was wrong - service was bad.  Hamachi came before the edamamae, we had to ask a few times to get our drinks.  The sushi menu is heavily mayo based - which I think means the fish isn't as fresh if they are mixing it with so much mayo.  There is just nothing fantastic about anything here and the food isn't great - that being said, it isn't awful either, hence the 2 stars instead of 1.  It was kind of random, when we got there - the music was fairly mellow and just kind of in the background - I swear at the same time the woman next to us got the smelliest fish dish possible that made us both want to gag, the music got crazy loud and was so kind of trance techno beat.  Hello, it is 8:00 p.m. on a Wednesday night, I came here to eat dinner, not to get my groove on -- not to mention, the fish was so awful smelling, I couldn't even think straight.  Needless to say - despite having half a bottle of sake left, we got the check and bolted ASAP.
author: Katie P.

description: very strange rolls, i kept walking by it when I was spending a lot of time in marina. finally went in and i like to think i'm some what adventurous. boy that was a mistake. oh well. i don't think i'm going to try it again any time soon.
author: Tiff W.

description: Naked Fish's Happy Hour is a great deal and recession friendly.  The sushi portions aren't any smaller (don't you hate it when it's happy hour or that Dine About Town deal and all of a sudden the portions are scaled to the price?).  I think you just have to get in the door by 6pm on weekends and by 6:30 on weekdays to get the deals.  I've run in 2 minutes before the last call for happy hour and been able to order the deals.  It's $3 Maki (you get all 6 pieces), $1.50 per piece of Nigiri, $2.00 Handrolls, and 25% off specialty rolls.  $4.95 appetizers.  The food and quality of fish is pretty darn good and I really love that they don't skimp on the portions.  I eat a lot and can get out of there (w/out drinks) for appx. $10.  FOR SUSHI DINNER.  For makei, I love CA rolls, spicy tuna, and rock and roll (unagi and avocado).  Handrolls are decent sized and the pieces are good too.  Specialty rolls: Mango tango is awesome (cucumber wrapped in this mago puree with crab i the middle).  Great deal, good service, and yummy and healthy.  A winner for this dealgal!
author: Deal G.

description: Ok I reviewed this before and gave this place 3 stars...but last time I went it wasn't happy hour! $35 total was enough to stuff 2 growing boys. Now that's what I call a deal. Nigiri for $1, all appetizers are $4.95 and all specialty rolls are 25% off. The sushi may not be top shelf but it's decent but for $35?! there's really nothing to complain about!
author: Roger T.

description: Great sushi.  My boyfriend took me here for dinner Friday night and it was a fun time.  Everyone who works in that place goes out of their way to welcome you, both coming and going.  We enjoyed some great Sake and Sapporo beer along with our three rolls.  They even let us make up our own roll and it was amazing : )  I just moved to the city and am so happy that I have found a great sushi restaurant close to my new home!
author: Amanda M.

description: Happy hours are dope. We got a good buzz and ate some sushi for under 25 bucks!!
author: Pete C.

description: Strictly average.  The sashimi wasn't quite melt in your mouth and did have a tinge of fishyness.  With all the sushi spots in SF, I probably wont eat here again
author: Julie C.

description: quite delicious and insanely inexpensive.  nice seating for conversation.
author: Tammy N.

description: The draw of this place is not the sushi.  It's the smoking hot staff.  The sushi is good, but let's face it, you go here to be cool first and eat raw fish later.
author: Will S.

description: Got seated in the nondescript back end of of the restaurant, which is basically a hallway with nothing even on the walls. The Naked Fish really fits the ambiance & Sushi, since for the first time in my life my rolls came out Sans the Sushi. Enough said...... check please!!
author: Bill K.

description: The bf loves this place, so I had to go and check it out for myself.  The firecracker balls are a must have, they have some creative rolls and the nigiri sushi is always fresh.  I can see why he likes this place so much.  The only downside can be the service and the decor, which is in desperate need of a makeover.  We'll definitely be eating here again.
author: S Y.

description: I really loved this food. Also love the price for what I ordered. Im new to the hood and I am so please to have a place like Naked Fish close to my house.
author: Tod B.

description:
My husband and I stumbled upon Naked Fish last night while looking for another restaurant. I recall that someone told me this place was good so we quickly changed our plans and went for NF. We were pleasantly surprised when they seated us in this very private/romatic booth. The rest of the restaurant is a bunch of open tables, but this little booth with curtains (oooh lala!) was open so they seated us there. The sushi was very good. We ordered a lot of food including the butter/garlic scallops- yum!! I ordered my traditional sushi dish - philly roll and shrimp tempura (okay so I'm not very adventuresome when it comes to sushi!) and enjoyed every bit of it. 
Prices were comparable to other sushi joints with that kind of ambiance. All in all, I would certainly go there again when I have a sushi craving. The only negative I would have to report was the difficulty finding parking- but then again its the city- to be expected.
author: Anita W.

description:
this place was nothing special. their sushi was good but nothing on their menu really stood out to me. i had a saki mojito which was pretty tasty, a little on the sweet side & too weak for my tastes. 

the downfalls:
-  when walking in past the sushi bar, i was greeted with the pungent smell of fishy-fishness. not the best first impression.
-  our party of five was sat at a four top, which wouldn't have been a problem if the neighboring tables weren't so close to us. i was sitting less than a foot away from the couple next to us, i was pretty much on their date with them.
-  the toilet in the women's restroom was broken. the kind soul who used it before me decided to drop the kids off at the pool & not inform an employee of the issue. so much fun for me mid-dinner with a stomach full of raw fish.
-  our waitress was nowhere to be found at the end of our meal so we had to wait a bit for our check. i didn't mind this so much since there was an adorable little girl sitting across from us that kept me entertained. i can't help but stare at blonde-haired, blue-eyed children because i know i will never have one. shame on you genes!

the only memory that i will take with me from this dinner was the inappropriate and slightly racist comment that my friend's roommate made towards our waitress. said roommate is some fraction asian but you wouldn't know until you asked & was, in her own words, "belig" at this point. she is eating her shrimp tempura roll & telling us how her family eats the entire shrimp, tail & all. our waitress happens to come over to check on us & miss "belig", who is practically yelling at this point, goes "hey your asian! you eat shrimp tail, yeah?".  our waitress turns bright red & proceeds to walk away without finishing refilling our waters.

oh, the marina brings out the best in people.
author: Lizzy L.

description: I've lived 3 blocks away from Naked Fish for years and I'm a very frequent customer.  They are my favorite sushi place in the neighborhood for actual sushi instead of partying.  Ever since they started delivering I've been totally taking advantage.  I live really closeby but it's so convenient and I always tip 20% or more on.  The best part of this has always been their english-speaking person that takes the orders - the only guy with good english at any of the local asian restaurants.  However, if you order from the woman it's a mess. Tonight she basically refused my business because I couldn't meet their ridiculous minimum, even though they have never held that to me.  It took them forever and they made a big stink about the whole thing.  I could either go out in the cold to go pick it up and forgo the fat tip I'd leave, or order from any other delivery in the neighborhood that would gladly accept my money.  So I did.  Next time if I order from Naked Fish and that woman picks up, I'm hanging up.
author: Christine S.

description: I'm only giving an star because the hostess was an absolute doll to us. I hope she gets out of this place soon. Okay, so we were late to dinner. The hostess was so sweet and still put us in a booth. My girlfriend recommended calling ahead to get a booth for me and my husband's 1 month anniversary. We were amped as we had tickets to see The Knife later. Holy christ. We started the night with Borat (hillarious) for chrissakes and all this was almost ruined by this restaurant. Like I said, I admit. We were late for our reservation. But hearing our waitress bitch out the hostess for seating us was preeettty awkward. I guess she decided to teach us a lesson by seating us near the restroom and bringing out all our food and drinks at once. That's right. Asahi, sake, miso, edamame, nigiri, poke (which by the way can't be made not-spicy because it comes "pre-made", I had to give her the beat box with that and ask if 'pre-made' meant 'from a bottle'. Sure did taste like it!) and our rolls all at once. I guess she saw me give stank face to my man because she came over to explain that "Once an order is placed the chefs make the whole order at that time." I nodded, because I didn't want to get my food messed with, but OUR FOOD ISN'T COOKED!!! I couldn't have any minutes to eat edamame and sip miso?!? Bitch please. Strange, but all the other White Marina couples had perfect timing with their meals. I paid attention. I don't know what it is about being a mixed couple that makes people think they can dismiss you... Geez. We haven't felt that in a while. Thank You Naked Fish!
author: Jackie B.

description: 5 stars for their amazing happy hour specials!! I have only come here during happy hour because coming at the "full price" times just seems ridiculous to me now. $3 rolls, $2 handrolls, $1.50 nigiri, 25% off fancy rolls and $4.95 appetizers (I always stick to the first three because they seem like the best deal). The quality of the sushi is good - I'd say it's like your average good sushi place - not amazing, but definitely solid. And for the price, absolutely unbeatable. If you can make it during the hours I would not hesitate to go at all - I think it's 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. Sun to Thurs and 4:30 to 6:00 p.m. Fri and Sat, but call ahead to be sure.
author: Rogue R.

description: This is a good but not great place.  If you are a sushi purist, you will probably be underwhelmed but the innovative rolls are good once in a while.  The gyoza is very good.  I don't know if they wrap their own but it is better than most Japanese restaurants.  The hamachi kama is outstanding.  Never overcooked and very good dipping sauce although I don't always use it because the fish is so good.  While I love rolls, using 10 different types of fish to make one roll strikes me as just wrong.  The firecracker roll is really good.  A deep fried tuna roll?  Yes, it is very tasty with the hot sauce and mayo sauce drizzled on top.  The snow white roll had to have been invented in heaven.  I would eat there for this roll alone.  The house tempura roll is one of my favorites as well.  It is very simple with tempura prawn and avocado but it is so good.  The regular tempura entree is very good also.  Light batter and crunchy.  If you want something Japanese but a little different, this is a pretty good place.  If you only like nigiri, you will probably be pretty disappointed.
author: David S.

description: so delicious.  not overly priced.  better then ace wasabi.
author: jessie h.

description: Great happy hour special, particularly the food.  Not the usual three or four items that restaurants usually have for HH, but rather three or four pages.  The firecracker ball is really good....deep fried sushi ball with a spicy sauce....mmmm.
author: LT B.

description: Happy hour deals are amazing! Oysters on the half shell $1 each... this place is awesome. Lots of creative rolls, very delicious, not as traditional. Enjoy! You must go for happy hour the rolls are 25% off.
author: J B.

description: The food is good, but nothing special. The only reason we continue to go back is due to their fantastic happy hour specials. The food is definitely good enough that the happy hour makes it worthwhile.
author: Eric R.

description: Best happy hour deal ever! They even have happy hour on the weekends which is a huge plus! The hot mama roll is the best, also their autumn roll is very good! HUGE selcetion of sake (half off during happy hour), service is ok, could be better and a little boring atmposphere too but the food and the prices are well worth it!
author: Luba R.

description: I've been here a few times and really liked this place.  It was quiet with a nice atmosphere and the food is good.  The firecracker balls are delicious and the rest of the sushi is good quality.  Nice spot for a date or a small group.
author: Glen E.

description: I have nothing but good things to say about Naked Fish:  The sushi is fresh and tasty;  Comfortable atmosphere;  Friendly staff;  Happy Hour pricing is AMAZING; and the location is great for grabbing a quick bite before heading out.
author: Erin R.

description: Delicious sushi with tons of choices...the firecracker balls are a must. It isn't pretentious and never too hard to get in.
author: Liz L.

description: This place is fantastic!  My wife and I walk here at least once a week and the waitstaff is very attentive.  My wife likes to put ice cubes in her white wine and was using her fork to move them from her water glass into the wine glass and the waiter actually came over with a glass of ice for her!  The sushi is very good and please try the Crunchy Cannon Roll which we get every time and I absolutely love.  Happy hour runs until 6:30pm Mon-Thurs so if you can make it after work the large Sapporo's are only $3 and the rolls are 25% off!
author: Rory C.

description: Wow, the third time was a charm.  I visited last night for the happy hour and what a deal.  The nigiri $1.50 a piece(scallops, spanish makarel, etc) was really fresh and the rolls were good, including the hand rolls.  The large Asahi was only $3.  The beef short ribs were great.  The service was very good. We had our own private booth near the back of the restaurant which was really nice.
author: Brian L.

description: i went there with a big group recently and it was great!  we were a big group b-day dinner with a lot of food and drinks and the bill was only  $40/person.  good food, pretty good service and great group place.
author: john b.

description: Worst service ever and the food was far below average. Ordered the tuna tar tar and what we received was completely different from what the menu described. Asked the chinese sushi chef about it and he replied "that's how I make it today." Waiter was rude, gave dirty looks. We are very laid back easy going people and didn't deserve the attitude at all.  Will never go again.
author: Brad W.

description: Awesome traditional sushi as well as some different stuff. The happy hour is a great deal.
author: S S.

description: With only 3 people at the Sushi Bar at 7:00pm and 6 people in the main dining room, I placed my order at 7:11 only to receive it 45 minutes later!  Not only was the hostess who took my order rude, she never once felt it necessary to apologize for the absurd amount of time it took.  A random waiter apologized and said it would just be a few more minutes at the 20 minute mark, then 30 then 40 minutes.  My request for something to be comped fell on deaf ears and after many inquiries to the hostess, she finally responded "this is how long it takes" and still no aplogy when I flat out told her not to blame me for their incompetence.  Unless you have 45 minutes to waste for mediocre sushi, don't bother.  I could have driven to Ebisu, had my order filled and gotten back to Pacific Heights in the time it took.
author: Rita F.

description: Sushi is sushi but we found the cuisine here to be extraordinarily fresh,  creative and delicious. The Red Caterpillar roll was a winner as was the Naked Fish roll.  If you like tasty and unique combinations, this is the place. Nice atmosphere, friendly service.
author: David B.

description: this place is HORRIBLE! i never normally go as there are so many other options in the area but everything was closed on new years day.  The food was well below average and the service even worse - they brought one roll at at time with huge gaps in between - after an hour we still hadn't gotten all our food so we canceled the rest of the order and left hungry.
author: Julia H.

description: I had a wonderful experience at Naked Fish last week.  The sushi was phenomenal, and the service was very attentive and friendly, and when the bill came I was very sure that this place is a really good deal.  Our server was really nice and made sure to check on us regularly, and the support staff kept water glasses full.    We really enjoyed the Spicy Tuna roll, California roll, and Sunset Strip.  The fried green tea ice cream was in a class by itself, in my opinion.   The atmosphere is festive and loud, so if you're looking for a really quiet meal this may not be for that occasion.   I had a great time and really enjoyed the food and wine, and it looked like their Sake list was extensive, too.  I'm telling people to go if they like a high-energy staff, vibrant environment, and great food for a reasonable price.
author: Derek R.

description: i actually enjoyed this place. not as much as zushi puzzel - but it helped i went during happy hour and half priced rolls. thanks to my friend keri to introducing me to the early bird specials :) i really like the fireball roll - probably because it was deep fried and had lost of sauce on it. nice enviornment - probably good for a first date type of place. can't wait for the next happy hour.
author: Miss O.

description: i'd really rate this 3.5 stars, but since i can't, i'll round down to 3 stars.  the best part about naked fish was the happy hour.  half priced sushi rolls and beer every night from 5:30 - 7.  sushi rolls are a bit small and overpriced for non-happy hour, but it's definitely a great deal during happy hour.  went with a table of 7, had 17 sushi rolls and 10 giant sapporos for $140, including tip.  rolls are fusion-y, one had pesto sauce on top.  definitely worth a trip for happy hour, but would skip it on a regular basis.
author: Olivia T.
